Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis. (I'm assuming "Albucasim" is an alternate spelling of Abu al-Qasim, a renowned 10th-century Andalusian physician often referred to as "Al-Zahrawi," who wrote many medical texts.)
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, as I have now completed this book for you, which is the culmination of the medical science, and through its explanations and illustrations, it seems to me that I should present this treatise to you, which is a part of the practice with my hand, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the practice with my hand is proscribed in our region and time, so that it has almost completely perished, and its science is hidden; only a few small descriptions remain in the books of the ancients, which have been changed to such an extent that they are filled with errors, causing their intentions to be misunderstood and their strength and art to be weakened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should revive that practice through this treatise in a way that is orderly and explanatory and concise; and to do so with illustrations of the cautery instruments and other tools used in the work, accompanied by descriptions and preparations, which are necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why no skilled craftsman is found with his hand in our time is that the art of medicine is vast, and it requires its practitioner to be knowledgeable in anatomy, which Galen defines as knowing the functions of body parts and their forms, as well as their connections and separations. One must have a deep understanding of bones, nerves, and tendons, including their number and structure, as well as the veins, both pulsating and quiet, and where they are located.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And because of this, Hippocrates said that a name may be significant, but the work is more so, and even more so in the art of handiwork (meaning surgery).
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this at the beginning of this book: for one who is not knowledgeable in anatomy will certainly fall into error and cause death, just as I have seen happen many times with those who lack knowledge and experience in this science.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I once saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor attempt to lance an abscess in a woman's neck, cutting into several arteries in the process, causing a large amount of blood to flow out, resulting in her death at his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who attempted to extract a large stone from a man's bladder, but in the process, he also removed part of his bladder, leading to the man's death three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I, having been consulted about the matter, realized upon examining the patient that he would die due to the large size of the stone and his overall condition.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was paid by a duke in our land to perform surgery, but he carelessly operated on a black castrated man who had a fracture in his thigh. [Quar per la forta strectura del metge no venia spiritu am la plagua e la carn de lu mori, e la ossa es infectada, e l’home al tertz dia es mort, e lo duc le feyt decapitar per so que aquel malefic acte.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio. E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon to treat the patient and proceeded to unwrap his bandages, achieving peace and alleviating his pain.

E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu. La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is because cancerous flesh is pure black bile, so it must not be lanced completely, but instead left in a place where it can be contained and prevented from spreading to the rest of the body.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios. E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz. But fire, due to its loftiness and the goodness of its substance, does not do anything but remove superfluities. And if it were not for the fact that it is not allowed in my book to reveal secrets hidden by fire and its operation in bodies and its expulsion by which it expels illnesses with philosophical demonstration, I would gladly explain it in your presence.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, son, that they disagree on the time when it is appropriate to perform cautery and they postpone the best times of spring.

And I say that cautery is appropriate in all times, because the harm caused by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is attracted by cautery, and especially if the cautery is for necessary pains or those causing pain, strong and persistent, which do not allow delay, as one fears the malice that may come from them, which is greater than a small harm caused by the time.

Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cautery is excessive over medicine because of its strength and the effectiveness of its operation and greatness of its power.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some point in time, depending on the complexion of the patient and the location of their illness, as well as its strength, and what has been prepared in their body by the accumulation of superfluities and what has come to them in their acquisition through food and similar causes. But this only applies if the illness in which cautery is administered is subtle in a member with few superfluidities and humors, like for instance cautery for tooth pain and similar ones, it is possible that the pain will not return, but it may occur to a lesser extent.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this saying is correct, but not in the way I understand it, for I believe that there is no cure that benefits with medicine or any other cause besides cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is the opposite of that; the meaning that cautery is the last resort of medicine is not that it is administered as a last resort in all illnesses, but rather when other methods of healing do not work, and at the end of the treatment process, cautery is administered and it benefits.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And so from this it follows that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not in the way that the common people and many foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this without reason, but rather because of the equality of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cautery does not matter, but this is not absolutely true, for I have proven and found that it only works in certain bodies, and cautery with that is good and better than iron as they said; however, when performing cautery with fire and gold, it is not clear to you, because gold heats up according to the amount of heat you want based on its color, and prepares to receive cauterization, and if you apply too much heat, the gold will melt in the fire, and this can cause accidents for the practitioner.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And so, to avoid these problems, cautery is performed with iron more lightly and closer to the correct operation.

And I have already organized this chapter on cautery according to the topics that I wanted to cover, starting from the head and ending with the feet, in order to make it easier for those who seek knowledge about it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cautery for pain in the head caused by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.[ coasts of the patient's thighs, placing a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization helps against the moisture and coldness caused by the secondary aspect of two causes: the cause of soddenness and abundance of humoral flow, called coryza, from the head to the parts of the ears and eyes, as well as excessive sleep, toothache, and migraine, and generally all illnesses that come from coldness, such as paralysis, epilepsy, apoplexy, and similar ones in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: firstly, you should order the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine and clean the head by purging it for three or four nights, depending on the strength, age, and habits of the patient.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head with a razor, and do so yourself by placing the patient's head on a tilted bench and having them place their hands on their chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor of your palm on the bridge of the nose between the patient's eyebrows.

And then gently lift your hand and check the location, and if you see that any amount of skull has been exposed, as much as the size of a grain of wheat, then raise your hand and if not, continue to hold the cautery in place with another one if it has cooled down until you can see what I have described to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little bit of salt and dissolve it on the location, leaving it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place a piece of linen soaked in balm over it and leave it there until the scar from the fire has been destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the location with theriaca balm until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that the wound heals better when it remains open, so it is better and more beneficial.

Capitol segon.	Chapter two.
Del cauteri del cap.	Chapter two: On cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is chronic and long-lasting pain throughout the head that persists in the patient despite the use of various remedies such as drugs, ointments, plasters, bandages, and similar treatments, and if a previous cauterization has been attempted but has not provided any relief, then one should consider whether the patient's skull is thick and resilient in nature and not weak. In this case, one can perform another cauterization using a different type of cautery, but only on the affected area and not the entire head.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize the affected area of the patient's head using a cautery until the spine is divided or separated.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the spine and expose the amount of bone that we have previously measured, then cauterize this area using a cautery at the back of the head in the location known as "vas", which is the place where a cup or ventosa is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful not to expose the bone too much during this procedure, as it can cause significant pain for the patient that is different from the pain caused by other types of cauterization on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I recommend using this type of cautery in the appropriate location, as the cautery used to treat horn-like growths on the scalp and back of the head is more subtle than the one used for other areas of the head. Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Chapter three: On cauterization for non-acute migraines.

Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	However, cauterization with a burning medicine involves taking a piece of aloe wood and charring it until the ends are blackened on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And make an incision in the spot of the pain in the temple with a lanced blade until it reaches the appropriate location below the skin, until it is hidden.

And apply pressure on the wound to reduce swelling and leave it for three hours; then loosen any ligatures and let the wound remain open for two or three days, and place a piece of bread dipped in vinegar over the wound until it forms pus.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And cure it with ointment once it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do so with some of the burning medicines which I have written about in my two treatises on such medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron should be performed in this manner: ignite the cautery of which this is the form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and is called a nail-shaped cautery, because the tip of it takes the form of a nail with a small protuberance in the middle part.

And place it on the location of pain and hold your hand steady so as not to burn the sinew that lies beneath, and slowly rotate the cautery with speed.

Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os. Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. And if it is about the protection and caution regarding bleeding from the cut artery, because cutting into an artery can be dangerous, especially for those who are not experienced or knowledgeable, then leave the procedure to a more skilled surgeon at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with a reminder of the regimen for controlling bleeding from an injured artery according to its method, in its proper place in this book.

Capitol .vi.	Sixth chapter.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	A tumor that has been cured and only requires the application of spices using a lancet, as mentioned in the chapter on diseases.

The shape of the cauterization is such that you place the cautery on the right side of the outer ear, slightly above the highest point at the top of the head, and on the temple as well, with a length equal to the width of your finger, holding it there until the tip turns white.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery tool, which resembles a knife and takes its form from the surgeon's table or workspace.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And treat the wound with appropriate dressings or ointments before proceeding with any further treatment until it heals completely.

Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi. Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of water descending into the joints.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of water in the joints through the signs that I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient something to drink that will cleanse their head, and keep them from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make them sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And order him to raise his head, and cauterize that spot on the middle of his head; and furthermore, cauterize that spot with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of watery discharge in both ears, or on one temple if it is the beginning of watery discharge in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise all the veins and arteries that are located below the coccyx with a cautery; and let the cauteries be in that line, at the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful not to cause bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see that there is bleeding, stop it with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with knowledge in the extraction of arteries, their incision, and the prevention of bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is necessary to cauterize the area below the two skull bones with two specifically produced cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient tears (or cataracts).
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears (or cataracts) in the eyes become old and are caused by the veins and arteries located in the visible area of the head outside, and it has been verified that this is due to excessive and persistent humors, then cauterize that spot on the head with a cautery as I have mentioned in the chapter on watery discharge in the ears, and also cauterize the middle spot on the head and two cauteries on both temples of the skull, and two cauteries at the back of the two skull bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to add more, then cauterize that spot on the outer side of the heel at the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of foul odors from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your treatment with the remedy I have mentioned in the division does not work, then prepare and give to the patient three consecutive nighttime drinks of crushed cochineal; and furthermore, shave their head and cauterize that spot on their head with a medium-sized olive-shaped cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And furthermore, cauterize that spot with a carnation-shaped cautery and two cauteries on both eyebrows just below the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to cut the artery (when cauterizing).
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the carnation-shaped cautery (cauteri clavelh).
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the use of cautery for softening the eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid becomes soft due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a crescent-shaped cautery (lunar), and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish (to continue with the treatment), cauterize that spot on both eyebrows with two small cauteries at equal intervals, and make them extend towards the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but only so that the outer third of the eyelid is affected (or seared).
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the use of cautery when the eyelashes turn inwards towards the inner parts and the palm of the hand (affects the eye).
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes turn inwards towards the inner parts and cause discomfort to the eye, there are two methods of cauterization: either with fire or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If using a cautery of fire, order the patient to read their eyelashes as if they were cleaning them, extending and straightening them until they are long and curled; and if it hurts when doing so, then strengthen the patient's eyes with a bandage around them, preventing any harm from affecting the eyes until the lashes have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once they have grown back and curled up, place the patient's head on your lap, and apply a sign (or mark) over the eyelid of the affected eye using ink, with the mark in the shape of a myrtle leaf, placed at the beginning of the sign.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And furthermore, place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or mucilage of pith over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And furthermore, heat the cautery, which has this shape:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And furthermore, cauterize over the marked shape slowly and gradually in small, even strokes until the surface of the skin resembles a myrtle leaf, appearing completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of health for this treatment is when you see the eyelid contracted and the lashes lifted above the puncture (opening) of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And furthermore, raise your hand and leave it there for three days, then place a compress of bread (or dough) over the area until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And furthermore, care for that wound with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the lashes return to their inward position for any reason and the eyelid becomes soft again, then perform the cautery treatment once more in the same manner as before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the lashes are on the eyelid itself, then cauterize that area until it lifts to its natural position and curls up, preventing the lashes from affecting the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with a burning medicine that I command the patient to use is for them to read their lashes until they extend and curl up, and furthermore, create a shape from paper or cloth in the form of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And furthermore, take some recognized soap and live coals, place them in a spoon. Yes? (Note: I'm assuming that you are acknowledging the previous translation or asking a new question. Please provide more context if needed.) And do this: quickly mix those substances together to prevent them from cooling down, and then spread that mixture over the paper shaped like a myrtle leaf, placing it on one or both eyes; furthermore, place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white under the eye, and have the patient's head rest in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger over the medicine and press it gently, without causing harm until the patient feels a slight burning sensation from the medicine, as this feeling is similar to that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And once the patient perceives this burning sensation, release the pressure on the medicine and let it take effect; when the burning subsides, remove the medicinal substance and wash the eye with water. Then, consider whether the eyelid has lifted to its natural position as a result of the heat or incision treatment, as it should be in that case. If not, reapply the medicinal substance to the area where it did not make contact and continue the procedure until the wound heals and the eyelid contracts.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And furthermore, place a compress of bread (or dough) over the wound until it heals from the adhesion, and continue caring for that area with an appropriate ointment or another remedy until it is fully healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And for you, during the procedure, it is essential that you exercise diligent vigilance to prevent any residue from the medicine falling into the eye, and if the eyelid remains soft for several days due to the lashes affecting it, then repeat your treatment over the affected area of the eyelid, using the same method as before, and furthermore, continue treating the area until it has healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men differ in size and smallness, and therefore, adjust your treatment accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it is not appropriate to hide the way of righteousness from someone who is eager in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the lacrimal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we have said in the discussions of diseases and do not consider your treatment, it is appropriate to cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place their head on your thigh, and hold their head with some minister between your knees in such a way that they are neither harmed nor agitated by moving their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or pork gelatin over the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then apply the cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave and have the shape of a reed or vulture's feather at one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it can be penetrating at the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it can have a handle like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is concave is better for this work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the fistula if it is open, and draw out any pus or dry it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then incise it and extract its contents.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the hot cautery over it, and be careful not to let your hand stray too far from the eye's cautery at the edge of the nose, so that you do not injure yourself or disturb the patient, and then place the cautery on the grooves of the eye and destroy it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery procedure you penetrate into bone, that is good; and if not, then reapply the cautery once or twice, as needed, and leave it in place for three days. Then apply a compress of bread and surround it with dry ointment until it has healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if ten days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a sharp corrosive medicine to expose the bone and scrape as needed according to what is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And here is another way of cauterizing a fistula that we previously mentioned: understand the location of the fistula and open it, then place a thin probe in the opening, which should be shaped like this: \_\_. Make it from one ounce of melted lead; hold your hand firmly with caution, and ensure that the patient is not harmed by the molten lead. It is necessary to place over the eye of the patient a cotton swab soaked in egg white or water because lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula has been healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer nose drops and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose as will be discussed later in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of wounds on feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times it happens that fissures occur in the lips, especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the previous discussions and your treatment does not yield results, then heat a small scalpel-like cautery according to this shape that is shown here:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its concavity be as thin as a knife blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place the heated end carefully into the fissures until the cautery reaches the base of them.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms in the region of the uvula or on the palate or in the region of the teeth, and it breaks open, becomes old, and develops into a fistula, and you treat it but your treatment is not effective, then you must cauterize the fistula with the appropriate amount of cautery according to its size. Then place the heated cautery tool into the opening of the fistula and hold it there until the hot iron reaches the base of the affected area, and repeat this one or two more times. Then treat the area with ointment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus has been drained and the wound is healed, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to expose the affected area and remove any decayed bone as will be discussed in its appropriate chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums have been softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines but do not achieve results, then place the patient's head in your lap and heat the cautery tool according to this shape: \_\_, so that you can quickly place the tip of the cautery on the tooth and introduce it into the opening while holding the heated tool firmly. Keep your hand slightly away from the flame so that the patient does not feel the intense heat of the fire until it reaches the affected area around the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times as you desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with saltwater and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because a decayed tooth is solidified and softened gum tissue is strengthened and corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or if there is a crack or worm in the tooth, and you do not achieve results with medicine, then cauterize it in two ways: either with a cow's udder cautery or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing with a cow's udder involves taking a cow's udder and heating it in a fire until it is red hot. Then take a piece of iron or other metal, wrap it in cloth, and place it over the end of the heated tool. Next, immerse the tool in boiling water and quickly place it on the painful tooth until it becomes numb.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat this several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip a piece of wool or cloth in the heated tool described above and place it on the painful tooth, holding the heated iron over it until it reaches the base of the concavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterizing with fire involves paying attention to the size of the iron or copper tip and making sure it is large enough to cover the affected area without the heat of the flame reaching the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And apply the heated cautery to the affected tooth, holding it with your hand until the cautery cools down; do this several times so that the pain may be alleviated either on that day or the following day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that while the cautery is applied, the patient fills their mouth with good saliva and holds it there for an hour and then rinses their mouth; this is the method of using the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize any extremity that you can, as much as it is possible for you to do so.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula (a tube used to drain fluid):
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter twenty-two.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of umbilical hernias (extrophulos).
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When the hernia (extrophulos) is caused by inflammation and cold humors, and it is not responsive to gentle digestion through medication, then you should perform cauterization with a cannula that has two open ends, so that the smoke from the cautery can escape through the other end. Place the lit cautery on top of the swelling once, and do it again if necessary until the hernia subsides.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is small, then cauterize it according to its size and leave it alone for three days, applying a dry compress soaked in good saliva over the burnt area until the inflammation has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or the cautery for this purpose is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter twenty-three.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of hoarseness of voice and constriction of the windpipe (alex, or trachea).
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the humors rise to the throat (quanal of the lung), especially when it is accompanied by congestion, then it is necessary for the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine in the beginning, and then cauterize above the windpipe (golaio) at the affected area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And make sure that the cautery does not reach the windpipe (golaio) or burn through the cartilage of the trachea, but only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And then cauterize with another cautery at the joint of the neck (cervical vertebrae) on the last spinal disc.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be rod-shaped, similar to what was described earlier.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with the previously mentioned methods until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter twenty-four.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by cold humors, and the patient does not have a fever or tuberculosis, but rather an old chronic condition, then cauterize with two rods on the breastbone (furcula) at the affected areas between the ribs and cartilage. And use another rod in the middle of the chest between the nipples. Let the cauteries be rod-shaped, similar to what was described earlier.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you prefer, make your cauterization punctate with the cautery called "puncta," which is described in the section on treating ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And let there be several punctures at those areas, and then treat it with the methods mentioned earlier until it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let the cauteries have three prongs, so that cauterization can be done with each of them. With one application, you can make three cauterizations using this method:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter twenty-five.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of titillicus (a condition causing itching) on the head of the penis.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the penis (caput glandis) is dislocated due to excessive lubrication and does not return to its proper position in a timely manner, then it is necessary to reduce the dislocation until it returns to normal. If the patient feels a small movement that causes it to dislocate again, as we have seen, then first reduce the dislocation by having the patient lay on their back or side and gently lifting the spine in the area where the head of the penis connects to the body using your left hand.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply a heated cautery that has two handles with these dimensions:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize along the spine, allowing it to penetrate deeply until it reaches the other side. The resulting shape of the cauterization will be like this:
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And make sure that it is fine-tuned according to the size of the affected area. The resulting shape will look like this:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And repeat this process several times, as necessary. There are eight cauterizations in total.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	Then apply a paste of roasted salt to the cauterized area and ensure that the patient is calm and at ease. Do not move the affected limb for some time until it has healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the upper part and not treated promptly, then cauterize over the muscle with a rod-shaped or punctate cautery to strengthen the joint, eliminate excess moisture, and promote healing.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter Twenty-Six:
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On Cauterization of the Stomach:
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When the stomach is invaded by excessive cold and dampness that disrupts its normal function and causes it to malfunction, continuing treatment with medication alone will not be enough. In this case, have the patient lie on their back and extend their limbs. Then cauterize the area with three cauteries: one under the breastbone about a finger's width in size, using a rod-shaped cautery; and two more below the first cautery on both sides of it, forming a triangle. Make sure to leave space between each cautery so that they do not touch, which would cause charring.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cauterization should be the thickness of three fingers.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the shape of the cautery be as shown in this diagram. If you prefer, use a large cautery on the middle of the stomach, shaped like a circle, as follows:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And if the patient is afraid of the cautery, then use punctate cauterization on the stomach: carefully place the cautery point by point, as you desire, and apply it to the skin in several spots. Then treat the area with the previously mentioned methods until it heals.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter Twenty-Seven:
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On Cauterizing a Cold Liver:
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain arises in the liver due to cold or dampness or excessive flatulence, causing it to deviate from its normal function and leading to superfluous egression, and treating the patient with the previously mentioned methods does not help, then have the patient lie on their back with their head raised. Place three cauteries of medium size on the liver below the hypochondria, as shown in this diagram:
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let there be a space between each cautery that is the width of a finger, and let the cauteries be the length of a straight finger.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press too hard with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of swelling is as wide as half a finger's breadth and cannot be contained by the cautery; and if the patient is standing on their feet; or if they are lying down, then let them lie with their limbs extended and raise their arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And if it is possible for you to use this type of scalpel-like cautery with your skill and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo it in the cauterization process, making sure that the entire width of the spine is sealed, thus affecting the whole body and reaching the intestines. The spine is delicate here, so keep this in mind.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter Twenty-Eight:
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On Perforating Liver Abscess with Cautery:
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess or swelling arises in the liver and you want to determine if it is located in the liver tissue itself or its outer membrane, then if it is in the liver tissue, the patient will experience heaviness and increased pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the outer membrane of the liver, then the pain will be intense and sometimes even exhausting for doctors to treat.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, it is necessary to have the patient lie on their back with their head raised. Then carefully locate the area of the abscess using touch, and heat the pointed cautery that has a shape similar to a needle, as previously described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And use that same needle-shaped cautery to puncture the membrane until it reaches the liver tissue, causing it to bleed and release pus.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with other methods for treating abscesses until it heals completely.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not necessary to use this type of cautery unless you have extensive experience and knowledge in the field of medicine, and have encountered many different types of illnesses. However, even with experience, one should proceed with caution when performing this operation. But ultimately, it is up to your discretion and judgment.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter Twenty-Nine:
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On Cauterization of Plague Sores:
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancients used to cauterize plague sores with rods made from the branches of Aristolochia plants in this way: take a dry rod about a finger's length from the branch of an Aristolochia plant, and make sure it is slender and pointed.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And submerge that (part) in oil and heat it by the fire, and then cauterize with a pointed cautery in that place which is between the continuity of the collarbone with the neck; and with two small cauteries below, one slightly declining to the part which is beneath the beard, and with two cauteries on what is declining between the fifth rib and the waist, declining a little to the sides; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest; and with another on the stomach, and with three cauteries on the sides; and with one cautery in that place which is between the two shoulders, and with two cauteries on both sides of the flanks, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not necessary to clamp your hand with the cautery, but rather hold it in an open position.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancient men used to say that some people among them use a cautery of iron similar to a ray and burn that (place) with it, placing it in the location between the ribs until they reach that abscess and the pus is expelled, just as we have said in the abscess of the liver.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with cautery there is not lack of fear, because one dies immediately if it happens in the location of a fistula where there is no healing.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Chapter 30: On the Cauterization of the Spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the illness of the spleen with what we have said in the treatment section, and do not conform to your treatment, then there are three methods of cauterization that are all correct: the first is to make three or four puncture wounds according to the length of the spleen, following the shape of the cauteries for the liver, which I have mentioned before.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And between each cautery there should be a width of one finger or slightly more, and the method of cauterization should be the same as what we have said for the cautery of the liver.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not clamp your hand with the cautery; and let the patient be lying on their back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another method of cauterization, which is to heat the cautery with two bellows, causing an elevation that we have mentioned in the chapter on dislocated muscle, and raise the left side of the diaphragm which is located at the level of the spleen where the patient lies.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let the elevation be according to the length of the torso, so that punctures can be made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two bellows, heat it (the cautery) well, in that location where you penetrate the diaphragm from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus four punctures have been made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a three-bellowed cautery.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And you should cure the cautery after it has been left to cool for several days, because this is more effective than the other previously mentioned causes of healing.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Chapter 31: On the Cauterization of Hydropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	The text states that cautery should not be used in cases of hydropsy generally, but rather only in specific instances of ascites (the accumulation of fluid in the abdominal cavity), which is referred to as "alcinte3" in the text.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When treating hydropsy with the methods of treatment that we have mentioned in the division and you do not follow your treatment, it is necessary to cauterize with four punctures around the navel and one each on the stomach, liver, spleen, and two on either side of the spine in the lower back, as well as one on the right side of the chest and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery should be proportionate to the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And let the cautery be left to cool down for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not move the patient from treatment to cauterization immediately, because it is necessary to add two understandings and quickly assist in healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used to cauterize the abdomen should be like a nail, similar to its previous form, and the shape of the cautery used to cauterize the back should be olive-shaped, as is its previous form.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Chapter 32: On the Cauterization of Feet and Thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are swollen with edema and filled with dark water (i.e., hydropsy), it is necessary to cauterize the feet on the back of the foot near the knuckle between the ring finger and little finger, and raise your hand with the cautery without twisting it; and then raise your hand without returning it completely, because the saturated water will drain.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be in the following shape: And then make two cauteries on each thigh, and on each thigh there should be a pointed cautery made with the tip of a knife-shaped cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cauteries should be in proportion to the length of the thigh: and one below the knot (of the muscle) and the other below the middle part of the thigh; and on each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the wound open for a long time so that some water may drain from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And treat the pain with those causes which I have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On cauterization of abdominal wounds.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the abdomen is weakened and made damp by an excess of humors that impair its digestive and retentive functions, which are located in the stomach and intestines, it can be treated using various methods of healing, without resorting to surgery. However, sometimes the patient may benefit from a cauterization that encourages the body's natural heat and energy. In such cases, use a large cautery iron on the stomach as described in the previous section on stomach cauterization. Additionally, use a circular cautery and four fine cauteries around the navel, as well as a small spike cautery. Alternatively, use two cauteries on the "alcatin" (a term that could refer to a specific area of the abdomen or a type of tissue) over large blisters or ulcers.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if sometimes the humors are excessive and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize on the navel and intestines, and lightly apply two cauteries to the stomach and near the inguinal areas, for this is a perfect healing with which you will not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When hemorrhoids are of a corrupt and thick nature, or are old hemorrhoids that have become corrupted with humors, they can be treated as described in the previous section without resorting to surgery. However, if this method is not effective, then cauterize with three cauteries on the pus located below the two small spinal processes (the spinous processes of the lumbar vertebrae) in a triangular shape, and then use a cautery above the navel, penetrating two fingers deep.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you suspect that the stomach of the patient is chilled and their food is not being digested, and their face appears swollen with abscesses, then cauterize on the stomach with a large cautery iron as described previously. Additionally, use a cautery on the liver, and another cautery on the spleen with a spike cautery. Leave the cauteries in place for some time, and continue to care for the patient until they are healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On cauterization of hernia near its rupture.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you cut into the hernia (atheyl), then use a cautery that has been prepared in the shape of a spear.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert the heated iron into the hernia (atheyl) that has been cut open, and place your hand over it until the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if there are many hernias (achieyl), then cauterize each one of them as I have described, and continue to care for them with the appropriate treatments until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery iron on a swelling (alquatin), it is more beneficial.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On cauterization of fistulas that are formed naturally in the parts of the body.
