Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the Cauterization of Closed Wounds and Similar Conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times, a patient with gout in the feet develops closed wounds that are called clavus, which are large and deep, causing inflammation on the side of the foot. Cautery for these conditions can be performed in two ways: using fire or using hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	However, cautery with fire involves heating the concave-shaped cautery tool that resembles a vulture's beak and is made of iron based on the size of the clavus from all sides, and has thin edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place the heated cautery on top of the clavus and rotate your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the wound until the cautery reaches the depth of the wound.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it alone for three days until the wound starts to produce pus.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made with wild mallow and salt, and leave it on for one night, as this will help eliminate the root cause of the condition.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the area with flesh-generating ointment until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	But if they do not heal and often occur on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then it is necessary to administer hot cautery in these cases. This involves taking a small piece of iron or copper or vulture's beak, and placing it on the clavus; and adding a little bit of hot water in the small piece, and holding your hand firmly and rotating it with pressure all around, and pressing the edge of the cannula against the root of the clavus, allowing the hot water to flow into the root of the wound; and let the patient endure the burning sensation of the hot water for an hour, and then remove it, because the clavus with its roots will be eliminated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do this to all of them until they are completely eliminated from the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then care for the remaining pus in the roots of the clavus with ointments that promote flesh regeneration.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the Cauterization of Tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When tremors arise due to nerve friction or fever from various causes, then it is necessary to cauterize the affected area with four or five cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with a single cautery; and with cauteries on the feet and on the stomach, using an olive-shaped cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of the affected area will subside and hasten the recovery from the illness caused by friction.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the Cauterization of White Spots on the Body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When white spots appear on the body and are caused by pustules or cracks that contain thick, corrupt materials, then it is necessary to begin treatment by cauterizing the entire head of the fistula with a fine-tipped cautery made from myrtle wood, with the tip extended using fire; or using long incisors; or using lenticular cauteries.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And some pustules are cauterized at the beginning of their outbreak in this manner; and they are not believed, and by breaking the superfluity, they heal from them.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But it is also necessary that this be done through evacuation with bloodletting.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of a flow of blood caused by an accident through incision of an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times a flow of blood occurs from an artery that is incised near the wound, either from outside or from incisions in abscesses or cauterization of a limb, and it is difficult to heal such a one.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens, you should immediately place your hand over the opening of the artery and press with your finger on the incision so as to obstruct the flow of blood from the wound until it stops.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then place the olive-shaped cauteries, large and small in number, on the fire so that they become very hot. Then blow on them until they are red hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	Then take one that is either small or large, depending on the location and the wound in which the artery has been severed. Place it quickly over the vein onto which you have placed your finger, and cauterize the area until it is seared and the blood flow stops.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood continues to flow from the opening of the artery as you lift your finger and remove the cautery, then quickly take another heated cautery from those that have been prepared in the fire, and do not stop doing this until the bleeding stops.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful that you do not burn the nerves that are nearby, causing another injury to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you should know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to stop the bleeding in any other way than by one of four methods: either with a cautery as we have described, or through extraction if it has not already been extracted, because when it has been extracted the extremities are better able to heal and the bleeding is stopped. Or bind it tightly with a ligature of either gall or lime for strong compression. Or apply medicines to it that have the power to stop bleeding; they should be strengthened with a bolster and proper bandaging.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But those who administer proper compression through the use of lime and binding with cloth or by means of burning causes and similar methods should not be trusted.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens when the doctor is not present and there is no medicine available, then place your finger over the opening of the vein as we have described, and apply firm pressure until the bleeding stops at the top of the wound, without pressing on the artery. Then sprinkle cold water with great forcefulness onto the artery so that the blood congeals and thickens; and consider what kind of cautery or medicine is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Here begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On incisions and perforations and cupping glasses and bloodletting and wounds and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the illnesses for which cautery with fire is appropriate and medicine that causes burning, as well as their occasions and causes, and the necessary instruments and forms of cauteries; and we have arranged the chapters from the superiority of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will proceed in this chapter in the same manner so that those seeking knowledge may be satisfied, and then on what they have asked about.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, my son, you should know that in this chapter is contained what was said in the first chapter on cautery, but in greater detail.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because it is necessary to exercise great caution in the operation described in this chapter, which involves many kinds of evacuation through blood, by means of which life may depend on the venesection or incision of an abscess or opening for drainage or purification of a wound or extraction of an arrowhead or incision of a stone and their similarities.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and often death in the majority of cases.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you not to fall into such a state of uncertainty, because sometimes you must treat illnesses with methods that are far from gentle.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them will flee from you because of their illness and easily die from it, either due to the severity of their condition or its duration, or because they fear that it signifies death for them.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And some of them will give you their possessions and ask for your help, hoping to be cured, but their illness is deadly.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore, it is not appropriate for you to consent to treat such a person; your caution should be greater than your desire for gain; and do not presume anything about this without certain knowledge that verifies it, and leads to praiseworthy succession.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And in the treatment of all your patients, use prognosis and diagnosis to predict their recovery, for this will assist you in acquiring fame and memory, praise, and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, my son, may God inspire you with understanding and guide and protect you, for this is in His hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have divided this chapter into sections according to what was said in the chapter on cauteries, treating the cure of the head to the feet, so that you may find satisfaction in what you have asked for and need.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the treatment of water that is contained in the heads of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You should know that this illness often occurs in infants at birth, when the wet nurse presses too hard on the infant's head.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it occurs due to a hidden cause that is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in infants; and all those whom I have seen with it are at risk of death, and therefore, I consider it best to leave them alone.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen an infant whose head was filled with water and was constantly swollen so that it could not stop growing until it caused death from excess fluid.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this fluid either collects between the skull and the bone or beneath the bone on top of the braincase.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation for this condition when the fluid collects between the scalp and the bone and the abscess is small requires that you make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure of about two fingers' width, allowing the fluid to drain out; and here is the shape of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And so if the fluid is more abundant and the abscess is larger, then here are two incisions that can be made according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the fluid is beneath the bone, one sign of this is that you see the seams of the skull widely separated from all sides, and the water is pressed out when you press with your hand on the outside of the head and it is not hidden.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	It is necessary to make an incision in the middle of the head with three fissures according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and empty the incision completely of fluid; and strengthen the tears with cloths and feathers; and introduce something (a dressing) soaked in vinegar and oil into it by the fifth day, and loosen the ligament and heal the wound with bandages and ointments, and strengthen the head with evenness; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture until the limb is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And this is another way of making an incision, which considers the size of the abscess and the collection of water, for sometimes it is larger in the occipital region, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore, pay attention to where the abscess and the accumulation of water appear, and do so in the place where it is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise an artery and beware of flowing blood, for the patient may die from that flow of blood with the evacuation of fluid.
Capitol .ii.	Capital II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On making incisions in the arteries which are close to the ears, called "temporal" or "temple" arteries.
Capitol segon.	Capital II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When some catarrh or wound occurs in the eyes or the chest, and it is old and does not respond to medical treatment, then the last remedy in this case is an incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore it is necessary when you want to make an incision in those arteries that the patient exposes their neck, and then rub the area with rough cloth to make the arteries visible; and also strengthen the patient's head with a cloth; and consider whether you can feel the pulse of the vein; and locate the points just above the ears, which are close to the temples, and are hidden in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then place a ligature on the artery with a bandage, and then make an incision in each one with a sharp spatula or scalpel, making the incision penetrate to the bone, and this should be done according to the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the spatula under the artery and break it at the point where it branches out into smaller vessels.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be adjusted to fit those two arteries, because when a vein is cut, blood spurts out with a pulsating flow, which sprays outside frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear in the incision, then it is necessary to measure three fingers' width from the ear and place a ligature on it with a bandage, and then make an incision into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And it is necessary to drain from the blood an amount equivalent to one egg yolk. And do not drain too much or too little from it, and all of this depends on the amount that you see from the patient's vitality and the engorgement of their artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And also consider the wound, and therefore if there remains on the bone any foreign matter such as a splinter or chip, then you should incise that area to prevent the formation of an abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And also strengthen the wound with feathers and bandages made of linen, and treat that area with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Capital III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the temporal arteries.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some occurrence of ancient or recent migraines, due to humoral imbalances in the temples or similar symptoms such as hardening or swelling in those areas, and medical treatment has not been effective, then we have resorted to extraction of the temporal arteries or cauterization as a method of treatment.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of performing the operation and extracting those is for the patient to expose the hairs on their temples; and feel for the artery that is visible in the temple, as it can be felt pulsating there, but may be hidden in some people due to excessive swelling.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then strengthen the patient's neck with a cloth, and rub the area with a rough or warm wet cloth until the artery becomes visible.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the scalpel with the following shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you should carefully dissect the skin and flesh down to the artery, using a tool with ease until you reach it; and then drain blood from the area and extract the artery by its upper parts until you remove it from the skin and uncover the surrounding tissues that lie beneath it.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then you should roll it up with the tip of your finger and make an incision on one side according to the length by which its ends are extended and contracted, and there will not be any blood flow, because if they are not cut, the blood will not come out completely.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then drain one egg yolk's worth of blood. within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you should tie it in two places with double-strength thread or cord, and do not let it become infected before the wound heals and there is no more blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut away any excess tissue that is between two ligaments, and do this either immediately or at another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that area with a cautery on the bone, using a knife-like cautery to make incisions at the ends of it, and this will serve as a substitute for that surgical procedure.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better if the patient has a fever or is of a heated complexion; for cautery is one of those remedies that help to dry up excess moisture, and therefore it is more beneficial in this case.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to perform venesection in the area that was previously affected, and clean powder should be applied appropriately, and then the wound should be treated with dry medicines that promote the growth of flesh and callus until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if during the procedure there is an unexpected bleeding from the vein, then you should take action to stop the bleeding by using a cautery or by applying pressure on the area with your hand until the bleeding has stopped.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of the above remedies are available to you, then place your finger on the wound until the bleeding has coagulated, and irrigate the area with water at a high temperature until the swelling subsides, and apply appropriate pressure as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And one lighter method of venesection is to use this cautery with two blades, by marking the two locations with ink and then cauterizing each one separately with a hot blade, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, thus stretching what is between the ends of it because it has not been completely solidified by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the sharpness of both blades be an example.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if the sharpness of both blades is less than ideal, then it is better to use one blade that is as sharp as two knives, for if they are too pointed, they can easily cut into the flesh and not make an incision with precision.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, in those cases where there is some thickness, the heat of the fire should be maintained in them and the flesh should be cut lightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this method is better than any other and more gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between the two blades be the width of a finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and sharp corns on the feet.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the corns are sharp and they are located on top of the veins on the forehead, and no medicine can alleviate their cause, and the patient's face becomes red, and they feel a sensation in their forehead as if it were an ant crawling, and their feet become swollen, hot, and their skin turns rough, and their eyelids are scratched by the sharpness of the tears. The ancient remedies for the treatment of these corns include using horse manure, and they name this treatment "spassa".
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you should instruct the patient to scrape off the hairs on their forehead and then make three incisions of equal length according to the length of their forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And let the length of each incision be two finger-widths: the first one should be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, the second one according to the length of the eyelids that are near the lacrimal gland, and the third one on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful not to cut the veins that are located on both sides, and keep your hand away from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And let the space between each incision be three finger-widths apart.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or dry cloths that you can use to soak up the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert a stylet with two sharp ends, and this is the shape of the incision it will make:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which starts from the temple and ends at the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape off all the skin that is between the two incisions, using a curette on top of the bone, and do this from the middle incision to the second one.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then pull out the stylet and insert another tool called a "cutellar" which has one sharp end and one blunt end into the first incision again.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the sharp edge of the tool along the skin attached to the bone and the blunt end on top of the bone, and then push it in until it reaches the middle incision, and use it to cut all the vessels that descend from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But make sure that the incision continues along the bone, and then do the same thing at the middle incision between the other two incisions.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since there will be a large amount of blood flow, squeeze the areas where the clotted blood has accumulated to stop the bleeding.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each incision a piece of old cloth and cover them with powder mixed with wine, oil, and vinegar, and ensure that they do not become infected.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the bandages and administer a large amount of warm water or tea, and then treat the wounds with basil ointment, rose oil, and other remedies until they heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of corns with catharsis and those that descend from the inner parts of the head to the feet.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there is continuous and persistent inflammation in a vein, and the patient's feet are swollen with blisters, their appearance is weakened, their eyelids are ulcerated and have fallen out, and they experience sharp pain and wasting in the forehead, then you can recognize from these symptoms that the matter causing the inflammation comes from many veins inside the head.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for this condition is as follows: instruct the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision at the middle of their forehead, making sure it is wide enough (starting from the left temple and ending at the right temple; and let the incision go through the bone; and keep your hand away from the temples that are affected by chewing). This will expose the bone.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Soak up all the blood with a sponge or dry cloth, and then place a piece of old cloth or dry cloth between the two lips of the incision.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And apply a compress soaked in wine and oil on top to prevent formation of pus due to cautery.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has diminished, then it is necessary to rub the bone that is at the beginning of the formation of flesh, and treat it with a drying regimen that causes the flesh to disappear, for example by taking two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mixing them together to make a plaster, which should be administered to the area of the newly formed flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of earwax.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The cause of earwax is one of four types: it can be mineral-like, similar to stone, such as iron or glass, or it can come from plants like wax or beans, or it can be fluid-like, such as water, vinegar, and their equivalents, or it can be caused by some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore, when stone or any other cause similar to those mentioned that do not belong in the ear is found in the ear, expose it to sunlight, and if you see the stone, distill oil of vitriol or cedarwood on it, and then administer extraction, making the person sneeze with caution, and block their nostrils during the sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some cloth or wool compresses in the ear canal, and pull the ear upwards to expose it to air, as many particles have been forced in with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not removed, then administer extraction using the tool called an ear spoon, which has this shape:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is removed with the ear spoon, then that's good; otherwise, administer extraction using a small probe.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if it is not removed by those means, then make a cannula from silver and insert the end of the cannula into the ear canal, sealing around the cannula with softened wax and oil to prevent anything but the cannula from entering.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with strong suction using your breath, as we have often mentioned.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not removed in this way, then take an alum-coated funnel or a device with which birds are caught using a small amount of bait, and place the end of the ray at the ear canal opening, and then cover the area appropriately with a cloth.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then gently insert the tool into the ear canal and dry out the ear to remove any remaining moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if it is not removed by all the means we have mentioned, then you must consider cutting the excess before it causes an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the method of cutting it is as follows: first anesthetize the patient using the saphenous vein and extract blood according to its properties, then place your hand over the ear and pull it upwards, making a small incision in the cartilage at the top of the ear and removing the excess while pressing firmly against it.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And make the incision in the shape of a crescent moon to reach the bone, and if the stone is found, remove it using appropriate instruments; then quickly close the incision and treat the wound until it heals.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the problem in the ear is an inflamed and swollen fatty tissue, then administer treatment and removal of it; but if the patient does not obey your instructions, then take a thin piece of spatula shaped like this:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and use that tool to scrape away the fatty tissue that has fallen into the ear canal.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not proceed if you think the earwax has been softened by the heat of the ear, but instead place some cotton balls in the ear and remove the wax with fine probes or a small spatula as previously described, which makes the removal easier.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But when water has entered the ear, the patient should first cause themselves to sneeze with caution, and then fill the other ear with some soft material and cover it with a cloth. If the water is removed by this method, that's good. Otherwise, take several thin and light stones of appropriate length and heat them slightly in the fire, and have the patient insert one of these stones into their ear canal and jump on one foot while striking the outside stone with another.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	And continue this process with the stone until all the water has been removed.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is completely removed, take a piece of paper or cloth. and insert one end of it into the ear and light the other end on fire until it burns off most of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then insert another piece of cloth and repeat the process until all the water has been removed, and then use a cannula as described earlier for removing foreign objects from the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But when removing a small animal from the ear canal, such as an insect or something similar, treat it as we have described in the previous section. However, if the animal is large and causes pain, then remove it with forceps and probes, as this type of foreign object is easier to extract than others that may become trapped in the ear canal.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But when removing a worm that has been generated in the ear canal, and your treatment using the methods we have described in the previous section and in the section on distillations and fumigations does not work, then you should examine the ear in sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if you see any signs of worms in the ear, then remove them using forceps or fine probes. However, if no such signs are visible, then take a cannula that is narrow at the tip and wider towards the top, with a shape like this:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the narrow end of the cannula into the ear canal to the depth that the patient can tolerate, and then use suction to remove all the worms. Repeat this process several times until all the worms have been extracted.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if the patient does not follow your instructions, then seal and close the end of the cannula with wax as we have described, and then administer distillations that have been proven effective in treating worms, which you can find in the section on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your method for administering ear drops is as follows: use this instrument, which has the following shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it from silver or brass, narrow at the bottom with a small opening and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore, it should be shaped like a plunger that fits inside the concavity of the cannula, where necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take a small stick and wrap it with a piece of cloth at the end, then pour oil or the juice of some herb, or any other of these medicines into the concavity of the cannula, which should be inserted in the ear. Then insert the wrapped stick over the cannula and press gently on it with your hand to expel the liquid into the ear canal until the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And heat the tip of the cannula slightly before inserting it into the ear canal.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful not to overheat the substance you will distill in the ear, as ear medicines do not tolerate it.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear blockages.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes children born from non-perforated wombs of their mothers have blocked ears, and this can also happen to some adults due to injury or inflammation in the ear canal. This blockage can occur either in the inner part of the ear canal, which is not visible, or in the outer part.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And blockages that occur in the inner part of the ear canal, which are not visible, are generally more difficult to treat.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And when you can see the blockage, it is necessary to expose the ear of the patient to sunlight and examine it carefully.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if you see an apparent blockage, open it using this spatula-shaped tool, which has the following shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	The tip of this tool should be narrow and slightly curved, with one side sharp and the other not, and it should measure two finger-widths in length to avoid causing injury to the ear canal.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the swelling is due to flesh born in the ear or inside the ear, then use thin cautery instruments and make an incision with great ease, so that all of the flesh can be removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the swelling is in the cartilage of the ear, then take a thin lancet, heat it slightly with fire, and then insert it into the flesh of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And if you have felt an abscess that the patient can easily expel due to heaviness in hearing, then gently relieve the pressure and make sure not to damage the ear's nerves.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a dressing on the ear according to the size of the opening that you have covered with Egyptian ointment; do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the wound, or take some and submerge it in vinegar and powder it over the area, using it three times a day. And if you see that the ear has become abscessed, then you must incise the abscess and replace the dressing with another one that is wrapped in wax-based ointment made with roasted oil until the abscess has softened; and then heal it until it is cured.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then submerge a sponge or dressing in cold water and place it on the ear, and use the other remedy that stops the flow of blood, which is called "distilled remedy" in the treatise.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Chapter VIII: On the treatment of blepharitis, which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Blepharitis, which occurs in the eyelids of the eyes either due to excessive moisture or sometimes dryness.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is necessary to have tweezers or lancets, and incise the eyelids with spatulas from their roots, and then place over the areas three times.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain and bleeding occur, then you should cauterize the area with a subtle ocular cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to make incisions and remove the excess growth as much as possible, leaving no trace of its roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned away and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Chapter IX: Treatment of styes that occur on the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often, lumps occur on the eyelids of the eyes due to a cause that resembles styes in strength and hardness, and because of their size they are called "grandissas".
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture on the lower and upper eyelids.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the procedure for treating these "grandissas" is to consider whether the growth appears on the edge of the eyelid and extends outwards, affecting the entire area; and if the cause is mild.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make an incision with a scalpel along the length of the growth, and carefully remove it from all sides until it dries up; then use tweezers to grasp the root and cut it away.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not equipped to make an incision in the growth, and can only penetrate the eyelid little by little, then this is not advisable.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the growth is large, then you should adjust it with stitches and heal the area until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	If the growth is small, then you will not suffer any harm from leaving it alone, as the ointment will restore and heal it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If the growth is extending towards the inner surface of the eyelid, then carefully lift the eyelid and use tweezers to grasp the root of the growth, making an incision as necessary; press gently on all sides of the growth until it comes out completely. However, if the incision made in the eyelid is long, this is not a concern.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And after making the incision, wash your hands with salt water; and heal the area until it is healed with ointment that promotes healing.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Chapter X: On the treatment of chalazion in the upper eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A chalazion is a swelling that forms on the conjunctiva of the upper eyelid, and it tends to affect children more; it worsens their eyesight and causes a thickening of the eyelids; they are unable to see clearly and tears form in their eyes as a result.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And this is why children are always touching their eyes and sleeping with their eyes partially open; and it is due to excess moisture on their lower eyelashes, which have already been covered by inflammation and a clear indication of the imminence of chalazion is apparent in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you can feel the beginning of chalazion within.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	One method of treatment is to have the patient place their head on your lap, and then place a cloth over them and apply some warmth; then create a circle with the cloth that matches the size of the affected area, and place it over the area while pressing gently with your fingers all around to encourage chalazion formation within the circle. Then make an incision in the center of the fluid-filled area using a scalpel with a small incision, making sure not to make the incision larger than the one made during bloodletting.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the case of a severe chalazion, it is necessary to completely cut through the skin until you reach the pus, as white grains often form in the most severe cases through an incision along the shape of the chalazion.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, remove the cloth that you have wrapped around your fingers and place it outside of the affected area, then roll it between your right and left hands until it is clean.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to apply too much pressure on the incision with the scalpel, as this can cause damage to the eye and should be avoided.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if no pus appears at the beginning of the incision, then you should continue making the incision with ease until pus comes out; and then remove it as we have described, and then place a cloth soaked in vinegar and wine over the area and hold it with powder.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And then apply salt three times, placing it in the concavity of the incision to absorb any remaining fluid.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the area until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an abscess forms in the area, then treat it with a softening plaster until it heals.
Capitol .xi.	Capital XI
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On the methods of cauterization using fire.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelashes are lost due to inflammation of the edges, and they become thickened and antiquated, then this ailment affects the eye and causes various symptoms such as continuous tears, swelling of the eyelids, and tissue growth inside that can lead to destruction of the eye, which is called entropion (tactinir del huel in the text). The cure for this condition is fourfold: by cauterization with fire, by using a sharp medicine as mentioned before in the chapter on cautery, by performing an incision and suture, or by using cannulas.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And so, you must place the patient's head on your lap, turn their eyelid with your left hand, and if it is turned outward, then that is good. But if not, insert a needle in the one closest to the edge of the eyelid, apply some filthy pus from below the eyelid onto the needle, place it near the hair follicles on the edge of the eyelid, and pull the eyelid outward with the needle.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then make an incision in the inner corner of the eyelid, below the lashes, using a scalpel from the lacrimal gland into the lacrimal duct; and extract the filth from under the eyelid, place small pieces of cotton or cloth underneath it, and apply pressure on top of the eyelid with a compress shaped like a myrtle leaf.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	However, it is important that the shape of the compress corresponds to the degree of swelling of the eyelid, as this varies from person to person. Some people require a larger incision in their eyelid, corresponding to the degree to which it has become swollen.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then make an incision with the scalpel along the two lines you have marked, starting from the lacrimal gland and moving into the lacrimal duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if the incision is as close to the natural eyelashes as the width of a king's crown (or "grossetut del rey", meaning roughly 2-3 cm).
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place a small piece of silver (an ounce) in one of the two corners of the eyelid, remove all the scurf from it, and use some glue or fine wool to attach its two labia together with the help of gum or lanolin. Clean up any excess blood, and if you wish, apply some adhesive to the superfluous pus on the eyebrows, using a few appropriate causes; otherwise, don't bother.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then leave the stitches of the wound undisturbed for three or four days, and take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without stitches and take care of it with drying and constricting remedies, because the eyelid swells due to the seal and accumulation of pus; but stitching is better. Therefore, I have said these things about entropion (taxanir).
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	However, if there is any concern for the patient's welfare, and it is a good idea to proceed with caution rather than out of fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method for treating entropion, which involves shaping the eyelid like a myrtle leaf and then lifting it up with three separate and connected stitches in this shape.
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, take a needle with thread and insert it in the middle of the shape, then insert the other end of the thread into the eyelid near the lacrimal gland and the other end near the lacrimal duct, and adjust their position so that they are evenly spaced. Then lift up your hand with equal force, lifting the entire eyelid as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the two sides of the wound with stitches and take care of it until it heals.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess forms after the incision or wound, treat it with cerote and similar substances, and apply ointments to it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelashes turn inward, and then it is necessary to use incision as we have described before. But stitching is more artificial in each case.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Entropion with cannulas is performed as follows:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And the method involves turning the eyelid and making an incision along the edge as I have described before, then using fine cannulas or rods that are as long as the eyelid and narrower than the width of a scalpel blade.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made an incision at the ends of each division, where you have placed the stitches.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And then attach each cannula with fine substances above the superfluous eyelid tissue, and constrict them tightly so that they will not move for several days. This will cause the eyelid to become necrotic and shrink until it falls off on its own.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if this takes too long, then break the cannulas at their perforations and take care of the wound until it heals.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	And once the wound has healed and become solid, the eyelid will be raised and the lashes will no longer poke into it.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the method for making two cannulas using this technique:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	And let the length and width of the cannulas be neither too short nor too long.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On lifting off ingrown eyelashes using a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the eyelashes are not natural but rather hard and rough and prickly to the eye, then the procedure for treating them involves using a fine needle and dipping it in a mixture of wax made from cedar resin and lion fat. Adjust the ends of the needle so that they are very sharp and pointed.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of these fields be one palm in length.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then make another fine mixture and apply it to the other side of the needle if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then have the patient place their head in your lap, with their face turned towards the sun, so that you can clearly see what you are doing, because this operation requires great precision and care.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the hair that needs to be extracted, applying gentle force so as not to harm the patient, and quickly push it in until you have extracted the ingrown hair above the natural eyelash.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull out the hair above and insert it into an incision made in the eyelid, removing one, two, or three hairs but not more than that.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand towards the inside where the eyelashes are outside, with a tweezers.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if you pull with tweezers and the eyelashes do not come out, pull with a probe that you have made from that (same thing), until the eyelashes are pulled out from the root.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then apply that to the eye, so that you can pull out the eyelashes and the probe, and the wound will granulate and close up, and leave it closed for two or three days, until the eyelash reattaches to its place and grows back as good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the eyelash is short, then attach an artificial eyelash to the natural lashes and lift it with that, or leave it in place until it grows longer by some length, and then you can lift it.

De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the treatment of hordeolum, which comes on the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When hordeolum appears on the eye, and it is a contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted upwards, to the right or left side, due to poor healing of a wound, cut or cauterization, and it is called "leporina", and this hordeolum can be natural or accidental, and it is caused by poor healing of wounds, cuts or cauterizations, or similar neglect.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The method of operation for this is to cut open the scar tissue and separate the lips of it, place a piece of linen cloth in between them, and bind them together until they heal. (I guessed that "meca" might be a form of a word similar to "piece" or "strip" in one of the Romance languages)

Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel. E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have mentioned is nothing but a correction of hordeolum, which does not return to its original form as it was before.
