De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On incisions for abscesses that occur in the lower abdomen, near the navel.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Many men often develop abscesses in their lower abdomens or other parts of their bodies that resemble mushrooms due to their subtle roots and large caps; the lips surrounding them are already converted (infected), and they can be small or very large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	I have seen one such case where two abscesses in the lower abdomen closely resembled mushrooms; they were white and had fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips around them were turned inside out and splitting open, with fluid constantly oozing from it.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I incised these abscesses and found one to be very heavy, weighing 18 ounces (unc). And the other one weighed 5 ounces (vi unc).
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation for incising these abscesses requires you to consider whether the patient is moist and their skin is white, soft, with fine roots; if so, then make an incision using a broad spatula and have cauteries ready in the fire, as much blood will flow from the incision and you must cauterize it if necessary.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	If the patient is weak and fearful, be careful not to incise with a knife; instead, take fresh lead filings and tie them to the skin using the method mentioned earlier; then leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tighten the lead filings in the stricture; do not stop tightening the large amount of lead until it is cut and falls off by itself without any effort on your part.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the abscess is large and there is a reason to be afraid or anxious, especially when it occurs in the lower abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is also possible that you make an incision in the abscess and then cauterize it to prevent it from returning.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then treat it until the wound heals completely.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to incise a tumor that is of dark color, has little feeling, and does not bleed much when cut, as this may be an abscess caused by cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come back with a reminder about cancer later.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52: On treating abscesses caused by blows or wounds to the body.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Treatment for a protrusion (eminence) of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A protrusion (eminence) of the navel can be caused by many reasons, including: a rupture in the membrane or fascia that covers the abdomen, causing tissue or hernia to bulge out; bleeding from a vein or artery; or trapped gas in the intestines. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical\_hernia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a rupture of the membrane and herniation of tissue, then the abscess will be similar in color to the surrounding skin; it may not cause pain, and its appearance can vary depending on the size and location of the protrusion.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	If it is due to herniation of the bowel, then its location will depend on the reason for the protrusion, with much greater variation in appearance; when pressed with your fingers, it will temporarily disappear and then return quickly; it can be easily pushed back in, but may become larger during physical exertion or bathing.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to trapped fluid, then it will not be painful and will not disappear when pressed with the hand; it also will not be constricted or enlarged.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	If it is due to bleeding, then the abscess will appear dark and purple-black in color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to fatty tissue, then the abscess will be large and firm with a fixed size.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	And if it is due to trapped gas, then touching it will feel soft.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation for treating a protrusion of the navel requires you to consider whether it is caused by bleeding from an artery or vein, or trapped gas; if so, then it is best to avoid treatment as there is a risk of serious complications as mentioned in the chapter on abscesses caused by arteries and veins. [Reference(s):](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	But if the protrusion of the navel is caused by herniation of tissue or membrane, then you should instruct the patient to lie on their back with legs extended; and then use a probe to examine the entire navel area and mark the location of the protrusion; next, have the patient turn over onto their stomach with their hips between your hands, and then use a broad spatula to make an incision along the circumference of the navel around the marked location; and then extend the herniated tissue outwards using large forceps, and tie it in place with strong or loose thread as appropriate. [Reference(s):](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then place the middle of the protrusion over the ligament and insert your finger into it to feel for the herniated bowel; if you find it, then hold onto it carefully and gently push it back inside the abdominal cavity.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	If you find tissue instead, then use forceps to grasp it and make an incision to remove any excess tissue. [Reference(s):](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if the incision is near an artery or vein, then carefully tie it off with thread and return to your operation; then take two needles and tie them with strong threads, inserting them into the circumference of the incision in a cross shape; and then tightly bind the abscess in four parts along the needles. [Reference(s):](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If you prefer, remove the needles and leave the area open so that it can heal on its own; or when the wound has closed slightly, make an incision along the edges to allow for better healing, then treat it with appropriate ointments until it heals completely. [Reference(s):](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbilical_hernia)
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to flesh or moisture, then it is necessary for you to evacuate the abscess as we have said, extract the blood or moisture that you find in it, and then heal and solidify the area with whatever is appropriate.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.[*](https://ell.stackexchange.com/questions/312460/the-following-text-is-a-medieval-medical-treatise-written-in-a-language-th#fn:1)
De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of cancer.[*](https://ell.stackexchange.com/questions/312460/the-following-text-is-a-medieval-medical-treatise-written-in-a-language-th#fn:2)
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have said, in the discussion, of the type of cancer and in what manner it is treatable with medicine, and that it is advisable to treat it with surgery so that it does not become ulcerated; and we have said cancer generated in the mother's womb and carefulness in the treatment of it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer is in a location where it is possible to eradicate it, such as a crab that is in the breasts or in the groin and similar locations on the limbs that can be completely removed, and especially when it is beginning and small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is advanced and large, it is not advisable to attempt to treat it, because it cannot be cured, nor have I seen or heard of anyone who has been cured, or that such a thing has occurred.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation for it, when it is located as we have said, is that you proceed and let the patient undergo purging of black bile several times, and bleed them if there is clear congestion.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And prepare the patient with preparation in which they are located for the operation, and prohibit them from consuming any food or drink; and make sure that the surgical instruments, such as forceps, are ready; and ensure that the cavity is completely clean and free of any remaining causes of the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow and do not cut it lightly, but press on the areas and wipe away the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument that is within your reach among the surgical tools.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is opposition to the flow of thick blood from a vein or artery, then cauterize it until the bleeding stops and treat it with other treatments until it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 50.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of hydropsy (dropsy).
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already mentioned, in the discussion, the types of hydropsy and their symptoms, and the treatment with medicine.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the type of hydropsy that can be cured with surgery is only the type of ascites (abdominal fluid accumulation), and it is not advisable to use surgery for the types of tympanites (distention of the abdomen) or hypochondrium (pain in the lower abdomen), because that is fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this type of hydropsy, tympanites, with medicine and it does not respond to your treatment, then consider, because if the patient has already become weakened or is suffering from another illness or hydropsy in addition, such as cough or abdominal pain, etc., then be cautious and do not treat them with surgery, because there is danger in doing so.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see that the patient has robust vitality, and is suffering only from hydropsy without any other illness, and they are neither infants nor elderly, then the method of surgery for them is to lift the patient between your hands, place a basin under their belly, make them expel the air in their stomach with their hand, press on the lower part of the abdomen, and take a sponge as follows:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	should be long with two sharp ends like a sponge, but it should have some shortness to it gradually, so that during the operation you do not penetrate the intestines and damage them.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And also consider whether the cause of hydropsy is from the intestines, because in that case you must make an incision away from the navel by three fingers' width towards the lower abdomen, to the right of it.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the cause of hydropsy is due to liver disease, then your incision should be to the left of the navel by three fingers' width.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the cause of hydropsy is due to the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not advisable to make your incision on the side where the patient will lie, because that could cause fluid accumulation in that location.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And also penetrate the entire thickness of the abdominal wall with your instrument, enter that incision and lift your hand with the spatula between the abdominal wall and the peritoneum (the membrane lining the abdominal cavity), and scrape it off; and remove a quantity equivalent to a fingernail or thereabouts.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And also penetrate the omentum (fatty tissue in the abdomen) until you reach the empty space and the location of the fluid.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then remove it and insert an instrument with this shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it resembles a thin silver cannula, made of silver or copper or lead, with a small hole at the lowest part of it, and on both sides there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other, and its tip is sharpened like a feather quill, as you can see:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the top of it is an armilla (a ring-shaped device), because when the instrument reaches the fluid, it quickly fills up with water and then evacuates it in half the quantity, as if you remove too much water in one go, it can cause the patient to die from loss of vital spirits or lead to symptoms that are indicative of imminent death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But you should evacuate it according to the patient's vitality and based on your observations of their condition, including the strength of their pulse and overall health status.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then remove the instrument and retain the water that has accumulated, which is caused by the abdominal wall retaining it through the hole in the omentum that you were advised to make earlier.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the procedure with the instrument on the following day if you see that the patient can tolerate it, and extract a small amount of fluid, and do this for several days out of caution, but make sure not to leave too much fluid behind.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you are concerned about the patient's condition and have left behind a large amount of fluid, then treat them with hot sand packing and mustard plasters in a bath, and expose them to the sun for a long time, and treat them with drying medicines until they are healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And use cautery on the stomach, liver and spleen during fluid removal, as I have mentioned earlier in what has been said before.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of newborn infants with non-perforated urethral openings.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes, some newborns are born from their mother's womb with the head of their umbilical cord not pierced (or it is pierced narrowly or not in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to cut the umbilical cord with a piercing (using a very thin spatula) in the following way as soon as the baby is born:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then insert a thin nail made of lead into the piercing and tie it (to the umbilical cord), leaving it in place for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when the child wants to urinate, help them do so and then return (the nail) back into its place.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you don't insert the lead nail, it is possible that the urine flowing over the area will not be able to flow properly.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But for the one with a narrow piercing (in their umbilical cord), they should be treated with a lead nail as I have said, for many days until it becomes wider.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But for those in whom the piercing is not in its proper place, it is serious, as this causes a problem, because for some newborns, their umbilical cord is too long and they are born with the piercing at the end of the penis, preventing them from urinating properly. They must raise their penis with their hand to allow the urine to flow until the cord shortens on its own; this is not harmful to the newborn, but it is serious because the semen cannot reach the mother as it should, leading to a prolonged illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	The method of the operation is as follows: place the patient on their back and extend the head of their penis with your left hand using strong traction, inserting the tip of the glans into the piercing using a sharp instrument like a feather quill or scalpel, without cutting any part, so that the urethral meatus aligns with the head of the penis and the piercing falls in its proper place as it should be.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And be careful during your operation to avoid causing any blood flow, as this often happens. Place a cloth at the site of incision to absorb any bleeding and treat the wound until it heals completely.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 64.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of albugo, which occurs in the foreskin at the head of the penis, and of corruption, blackening, and adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Often, this type of albugo occurs on the penis and is a prominent growth that becomes severe.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one type is malignant, while the other is not. [*]  La que es maligna es mes laga e perillosa e es aquela que va sobre le cap del vergua, la qual causa es quan la carn de la vergua esta contusa e infecta per algun accident;
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	The non-malignant type should be treated by suspending it with fine sutures and cutting it off completely. Then apply a compress soaked in Egyptian ointment to the wound, followed by treatment with a deficient ointment until healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	If the albugo is malignant and has a dark color, then it is necessary to use cauterization near the incision site and remove as much of it as possible.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the albugo is in the foreskin of an uncircumcised penis, and one part of it is inside the foreskin while the other part is outside, then it is necessary to remove the albugo that is inside at the beginning until it becomes solid. Afterwards, you can treat the outside portion, because if you treat both portions together with the foreskin, there is no guarantee that it will not become infected.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	Often, blackening and corruption occur in the genitals and foreskin, so it is necessary to remove all that has become darkened or corrupted, or will become corrupted. Then, apply a mixture of honey, flour from ground millet, and sieved crushed ivy leaves.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat the area with the other treatment until it heals completely.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is bleeding, administer a lunar caustic as follows:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because caustics can be used in two ways at the same time, either to stop bleeding or to treat a corrupted wound.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	If the head of the penis becomes corroded and is destroyed in an instant, it is necessary to insert a lead catheter into the foreskin to allow the patient to urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the case of adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (which does not occur unless the foreskin is healthy and uncircumcised, but may occur due to injury or abscess), it is necessary to perform a blunt dissection with a scalpel until the ligaments are dissolved and the glans are completely freed.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	If it is difficult to separate the adhered foreskin from the head of the penis carefully, then it is necessary to perform a blunt dissection with a scalpel on both the glans and the foreskin. This is because the foreskin, when thin, can easily be pierced due to its delicate nature.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	Then carefully separate the foreskin from the head of the penis with a thin reed that has been soaked in water to prevent further adhesion.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then treat it with styptic powder until it heals completely.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of infants and the treatment of issues that arise from circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not like other wounds or injuries in that it is an intentional act, and the care of infants after this procedure requires special attention. Therefore, it is necessary to assign the best method and lightest approach to ensure their health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not practice circumcision on their free men because it was not part of their laws. However, we have learned through experience that circumcision is beneficial for infants. This is why most surgeons and barbers use a scalpel or razor for circumcision and ligation with thread and incisions using nails.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura. Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	However, using a nail in the operation can easily cause damage and corrupt your work.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of infants is naturally short, and many times it does not require circumcision. I have seen this myself.

But through experience, I have found that circumcision using forceps and ligatures with suture is the best method because the forceps are designed for proportional incision, meaning the sharpness of the instrument above matches the sharpness below. This allows for precise cutting as you apply pressure evenly on both sides, ensuring a clean cut without error. La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	Here is the shape of the forceps used for circumcision:

E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And continue to care for the wound as previously recommended until it heals completely.

De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Treatment for urinary retention in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Urinary retention in the bladder can be caused by obstruction due to a stone or coagulated blood, pus or flesh, and similar causes as mentioned in the previous section on methods of treatment.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs. E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible. Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, the pressure on the lower abdomen will help to constrict the bladder and encourage expulsion of the stone towards the back, allowing for urine to flow freely again.

If the stone is not dissolved with the previously mentioned methods and becomes a serious problem for the patient, then it is necessary to extract it using an instrument called a syringe, which has this shape: It should be made of silver, thin and concave like a bird's quill with a length similar to a palm and a half, with a thin cannula at the tip. [*]  E aprop conponeys le siringua sobre la peyra e trahys aquela am gentil traicio entro que sia dissolta en lo sieu loc; e si no es dissoluda, lahoras cove que tu la extirpes per aquella via.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	The method of extracting urine with the syringe is to take double-folded thread or cloth and tie it tightly around the tip of the instrument. This should be done in order, but if there's a deviation causing tortuosity, proceed accordingly.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	Then gradually extract the bile using soft wool, as the wool absorbs the urine.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract it (the stone) and perform a cure using the catheter without stopping, until the bladder is emptied and the patient feels relief.

De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the quality of bladder irrigation using a clamp-like device and similar instruments that are suitable for this purpose.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is an ulceration or abscess in the bladder, or coagulated blood within it, or if the urethra is narrowed, and you wish to irrigate the area with water and medicine, then use an instrument known as a clamp-like device, which has this form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	...but its exterior is closed (blocked).
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it, there are three openings: two on one side, allowing for urination.

At the beginning, there is a concave space that holds (retains) what is inserted into it, and its size corresponds to the amount that is placed inside; when any force is applied on the fluids within, causing them to be drawn out, they should be expelled in this manner. Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the Extraction of Stones.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already discussed in the division of stones and their cures using medicines, as well as the difference between stones generated in the kidneys and those generated in the bladder, along with signs indicating their presence.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that stones can be operated on using a hand and a scalpel.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly speaking is that which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	I will now describe this with clear and concise explanation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	I say that the stone generated in the bladder mainly affects children; and its signs are: the urine that flows from the bladder resembles water in its subtlety, appearing as sand in it; the patient rubs their urethra and experiences frequent pain, which is sometimes severe; and they have difficulty sitting down due to discomfort.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the healing of children with this condition occurs before they reach 14 years old, but it is difficult to cure in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in young people, it is easier due to their age and vitality.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And for the person with a larger stone, the cure is more difficult; and if there are few (stones), it is contrary to this.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of this condition, it is necessary at the beginning that the patient be cleaned using an enema that extracts all the folds in their intestines, as these folds sometimes prevent the removal of the stone due to its location.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas. E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos. Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the area, cut into it immediately with a scalpel.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul. E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually move your finger towards the neck of the bladder, feeling the path as you go.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press on the stone with your finger and gently push it out of the bladder through the incision you made earlier.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And instruct the assistant to press on the bladder with their hand; and instruct another assistant to use one hand to extend the patient's legs upwards, while using their other hand to support the lower back, just below the incision site.

And make an incision in the area between the patient's rectum and legs, not too close to the anus, but rather towards the left hip bone; the incision should be made over the stone, with your finger inside the rectum, creating a transverse cut that is wider on the outside and narrower on the inside, according to the size of the stone. Make the incision as small as possible while still allowing for easy removal of the stone; this will minimize compression of the finger holding the stone during extraction.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some stones have an angle and edges, making it difficult for urine to pass from them.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And that one resembles a lion's glans (or acorn) in shape, and is round, and is made of relatively easy-to-urinate material.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is one with angles and edges, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not easily adjustable, then you should engrave on that one, or apply force to it appropriately, with the end of the instrument being like a file with which you apply force to the stone, and do not avoid contact with it; or insert a thin instrument with a curved tip under it.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot get on top of it, then widen the hole slightly, and if you want blood flow, cut it strongly with three times heated vitriol.

E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.
