sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	be as sharp as possible, and suitable for opening concave veins that appear thick and contain thick blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of the olive bloodletting tool:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this bloodletting tool is of smaller width and has a finer point, and it is suitable for bloodletting from fine veins that contain thin yellowish blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of bloodletting from the basilic vein is one of three veins: for extracting blood from diseases that are below the groin and neck, and for drying out the chest and stomach.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the bloodletter, when performing bloodletting on that vein, to be careful and to exercise great caution, as there is an artery beneath it, and if they make a mistake and hit the artery with the bloodletting instrument, it will cut into that artery and cause a flow of blood, so one must not perform bloodletting using a piercing instrument, but instead use ascillis.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear clearly, then it is necessary to leave that one and move to the other, or look for a branch of it, or perform bloodletting at the end of the arm, as that one is visible, and dry it using ascillis, as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want bloodletting from the median vein, then it is necessary to touch the location at the bend of the arm where you know the pulse is, and place your hand on top with a linen cloth; and then bend the arm and dry the vein using concave sectioning with ascillis, as we have said before; and ensure that there is no percussion for some distance around the location of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as you strengthen the ligament, an inflation in the location that you have marked with a linen cloth, then that inflation is from the artery, and so avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flowing in the bloodletting as if it were a child's urine, and the blood is thin and red, then know that it is from the artery; and so you should put your finger on top of it for a long time; and then remove your finger and press it firmly, and if the bleeding has stopped, since it often does, then strengthen the arm and let it be.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the patient from their phlegm, and be cautious with them and do not harm them for several days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the bleeding has not stopped and you do not have medicine to address it, then you should cut into the artery if it is visible; for its tip will be contracted and the blood will be cut off; or take a piece of lint and stuff it in there, and then place a compress on top and tighten it with a ligament and bandages around the area of the vein for the next day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And so if the bleeding has stopped, that is good; and if not, then treat it with what is mentioned before in the memory of the location of the powders for stopping blood flow.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And stopping the bleeding from an artery is difficult in many cases due to the small size of the wound and the possibility of ligature of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But bloodletting from the fusca vein is beneficial for extracting blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body, as it is composed of branches of the basilic and cephalic veins, as we have said before.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is necessary for the bloodletter to be cautious when performing bloodletting on that vein, as there is a nerve beneath it; and so if they accidentally hit the nerve with the bloodletting instrument and damage it, it will cause numbness, and it will be difficult to heal, and it may not heal completely. And this nerve often manifests in sensation; and if it is hidden from some people and subtle and not visible, then one must be careful and avoid hitting the nerve with the bloodletting instrument using their strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you should cut the vein lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of bloodletting from the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and relieves diseases of the heels.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is necessary in this case to use the myrtle or olive bloodletting instruments specifically, as they are the safest for all veins, as there are no arteries or nerves beneath them.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But it is necessary for you to be careful during bloodletting that you do not only prick the cap of the forearm, but instead look for a lighter location and do not pay attention to it if it is not found using the initial percussion that is above that area with bloodletting several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is rare for some people to develop abscesses when they are not bled in the initial percussion, but this is not noticeable until later.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the method and accidents of bloodletting from that are many, in which you must consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first thing to consider is that bloodletting should not be administered except for the preservation of health and as a precaution against disease, and it should be performed on one of the veins in the cubital fossa, namely the cephalic, fusca, or basilic vein. Additionally, bloodletting should be performed at the beginning of spring, before breakfast in spring and fall, and during winter near mealtime when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And bloodletting should be performed every third day or on the first day after three hours have passed from sunrise.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But bloodletting that is administered, except when it is necessary due to convenience or need, either at night or during the day, at any hour and in all seasons.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And it is necessary that a child should not be bled until they reach the age of fourteen, and a pregnant woman should not be bled except between the fourth and seventh month, and the elderly should not be bled who have already passed the age of sixty.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be bled in any way, it is necessary that they clean their intestines before bloodletting with a lion's claw suppository if there is a lot of retained feces in them, so that the veins do not draw out impurities during the bloodletting of the intestines, which are pure, and do not pollute the main members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And patients should not be bled in cases of sacred ailments, nausea, or hangover, nor should they be bled while ill or intoxicated until their condition has improved, nor in cases of dropsy. Furthermore, bleeding should be avoided in colic, vomiting, abdominal pain, increased production of bile and phlegm, excessive exercise or fasting, vigils, and all causes that weaken the body's strength, whether corporeal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider the refinement of humors beforehand: if the blood is thick, modify it with food and drink, and with medicines if that is possible.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter the bath if no cause forbids it, or engage in some exercise so that the blood may be refined.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And perform the phlebotomy on them in the foot, around the third hour of the day, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And ensure that the foot is protected on that day from all harmful influences, both mental (such as anxiety, anger, and fear) and physical (such as excessive labor, pain, coughing, and similar conditions).
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And let there be present at the patient's bedside causes that are commonly used by men for their fragrance and smell, such as spices and balms, according to what is possible.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist sit on a cushion that is higher than the patient's cushion, who is to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And let him extend his arm, and the phlebotomist should wipe it with his hand two or three times; then let him bind the ligature tightly with a strap and wrap it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the tightening be moderate: if the tightening is too loose or if it is done excessively, it prevents the flow of blood; if it is too loose, it prevents the body from expelling enough blood.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And let the patient rub his hands together until the veins are engorged and can be felt.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And let the phlebotomist anoint his lancet with a little antiseptic oil; then place his left index finger on that vein just below the location where he wants to make the incision, so that the vein moves slightly away and the percussion is easier. This way, he can find the correct vein, which will contract when pressed upon. The phlebotomist should then uncover the lancet and proceed with caution: if the vein is not opened or if it is only opened a little, this means that it was the correct one to use.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, it is necessary for the phlebotomist to be skilled and attentive in all these matters.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And let the phlebotomist wait after making the incision, but if the vein is located in a fold of skin, that's good; otherwise, try another location nearby or make the incision more quickly if the area is not inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the area is inflamed or the patient is feverish, then wait a day or two and do not bind the ligature tightly, for this could cause an abscess or prevent healing. Also, do not enter the bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And let the phlebotomy be repeated if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the opening is small and the blood flows slowly, and you fear that not enough blood will be released, then repeat the phlebotomy in the same location according to what is appropriate and slightly adjust the incision, doing so quickly before the area becomes inflamed, for in some people, even a small incision can easily become infected.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that the area has already become infected, do not repeat the procedure there, for this will not solve anything; instead, place some oil on a separate part of the incision to alleviate the pain and discomfort caused by blood accumulation.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And in this case, it is better to use oil than other substances.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Similarly, apply a small amount of oil to all incisions made during phlebotomy in order to prevent the formation of clots; this can be done using theriac and aloe, which should be applied on one side of the incision after it has been made, as these substances help thin the blood and reduce its viscosity.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess forms at the site of the phlebotomy due to multiple factors, particularly in those who are not accustomed to bloodletting or who have a small vein opening, then you should apply a hot compress made by soaking a sponge in warm salt water and squeezing it out slightly; place this over the wound for an hour, as heat helps dissolve clots.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	It is important that this be done immediately after the blood has stopped flowing from that vein or another one, so as to prevent clotting.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if a dark or greenish color remains in the wound for several days, do not be concerned; but if you wish, apply some crushed aloe and myrrh, or some juice from mint leaves or chamomile, which have anti-inflammatory properties.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	Often, abscesses and swellings occur after bloodletting from the basilic vein, which is located in the arm.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	Therefore, if you feel softness when you press on the area after bloodletting from the basilic vein, this indicates that an abscess is present; in this case, be careful not to apply too much pressure, as doing so may cause further bleeding from the artery. Instead, use one of the remedies previously mentioned to treat the abscess.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Also, apply a styptic poultice to the area to strengthen and heal it; continue this treatment until the wound is fully healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	It is important to extract the correct amount of blood from each person based on their strength and complexion, as indicated by the color and appearance of their blood.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	This is because if the blood appears dark, it should be allowed to flow until it becomes red; similarly, thick blood should be allowed to flow until it thins out, and sharp or fast-flowing blood should be allowed to continue flowing until its speed has been reduced.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	It is important that a larger incision be made when performing bloodletting on a person who is overweight and in need of significant blood loss; this will allow for easier extraction and prevent complications.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	However, the opposite should be done when performing bloodletting on a frail or weak person: smaller incisions should be made and bloodletting should be performed in multiple stages to prevent excessive loss of blood.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	The best method for venous phlebotomy is a transverse incision, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of phlebotomy is safer and less likely to cause nerve damage or excessive bleeding compared to making incisions along the length and width of the vein.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	Those who are prone to fainting during bloodletting should be treated with a small piece of bread soaked in muscatel wine or simple oxymel (a mixture of honey and vinegar) before the procedure; this will help prevent a drop in blood pressure and reduce the risk of fainting. Additionally, bloodletting should be performed in three or four stages to minimize blood loss.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	If the patient has a cold complexion, they should be given bread soaked in myrrh syrup or fragrant honey syrup seasoned with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, and ginger, or in an aromatic and fragrant syrup before the bloodletting procedure to help warm their body.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	If fainting occurs during bloodletting and is caused by excessive blood loss, the patient should drink water infused with meat extract and a fragrant and subtle syrup; they should also use aromatic substances such as aloe, and apply a linen bandage to their head.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	Use the other methods mentioned in the section on fainting for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	Those who wish to bleed their arms and thin their blood gradually should have the procedure performed in stages, with small amounts of blood removed each time; this is especially important for those with weak constitutions, as excessive bleeding can be harmful. The process should be repeated on consecutive days if necessary.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	However, those who wish to bleed their arms and thin their blood more than once should wait seven or nine hours after the initial procedure if they have a strong constitution; this will allow enough time for the body to recover before undergoing additional bloodletting.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	However, those who wish to draw blood away from their body in the opposite direction of its natural flow should wait until the second or third day after the initial procedure. This will allow enough time for the body to recover and prevent excessive bleeding.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	However, in cases where a person has an excess of blood that is causing fever and inflammation, it is necessary to remove a large amount of blood in one sitting, even if this results in fainting; this should be done while taking all necessary precautions and monitoring the patient's vital signs. The phlebotomist should also place their hand on the patient's pulse during the procedure to ensure that they do not accidentally cause death instead of fainting, as can sometimes happen when the practitioner is inexperienced or negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	It is not advisable to forcefully press on the arm and bend it when attempting to bleed and evacuate blood a second time if the vein opening has already closed and the flow of blood has become difficult; this can cause damage to the vein and is strongly discouraged.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Instead, wait until the vein can be safely reopened; or use a lancet to gently break up any clots that have formed in the vein opening; or apply a poultice made from theriac or aloe to help dissolve any blockages and encourage the flow of blood. Gently press on the area until all the blood has been expelled.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	If the vein is inflamed or infected, do not attempt to bleed it and wait until the inflammation has subsided before attempting any further procedures.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	If it becomes necessary to bleed again and the previous vein cannot be used, then select a different location on the same arm or a vein in the other arm for the procedure.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	The vein called the "funis of the arm" can be bled when the cephalic or basilic veins cannot be found or are too deep, as it shares properties with both of these veins.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of bloodletting is that the patient should immerse their arm in warm water until the vein becomes visible and swells, making it easier to locate and make an incision.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And let the ligature be tied with moderate tightness around the upper arm; and let the incision be made transversely, not lengthwise or across the width of the vein.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be large and made with the lancet at the joint of the hand, just a little ways into the vein.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	If blood flow is not occurring as desired, repeat the immersion of the arm in warm water and allow the blood to continue flowing into the water until the necessary amount has been extracted.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	However, during the summer months, it is not necessary to repeat the immersion of the arm in warm water, and instead, simply allow the blood to flow into a container of warm water during the winter months.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	Bloodletting from this vein is safer than from other veins, as there are no pulsating arteries or nerves located near it.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	Bloodletting from the little finger of the right hand is beneficial for liver ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The quality of bloodletting from this vein is that you should bind the arm with a ligature or your hand after immersing it in warm water until the vein becomes swollen and clearly visible; then make a transverse incision, and even if a nerve is accidentally severed, it will not be harmful.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Be careful not to cut too deeply with the lancet, as the nerves in this area are close to the surface and can be easily damaged.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And let the arm be re-immersed in warm water and allow the blood to continue flowing out, as failure to do so may result in clotting of the blood in the incision and prevent further flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	After extracting the necessary amount of blood, apply a mixture of oil and salt to the incision to prevent it from healing too quickly and becoming clotted; this should be done on all veins after bloodletting.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	The help of bloodletting from the left arm is that it is beneficial for diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And perform bloodletting on the patient in a similar way as you did on the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of the saphenous vein in bloodletting is for diseases that are in the lower part of the body, such as diseases of the womb and retention of menstruation, and diseases of the haunches and old ulcers of thighs and legs, and similar diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The method of bloodletting from the patient is that they place their foot in warm water and rub it until the veins become visible; then tie a bandage above the ankle joint; and the location of the vein should be marked, as its branches are numerous on the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, perform bloodletting from the large vein below the knee, near the calf, towards the ankle, as it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform bloodletting on the surface of the foot, then be careful of the nerves that are below it on the surface of the foot, and perform bloodletting with a lancet perpendicularly, as if you wanted to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the blood flow moderately.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the outflow of blood is forbidden, then place the patient's foot in warm water and allow the blood to flow freely until it has been evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the lancet misses its target in the first attempt, then try again a little higher with the bloodletting, as the area is safe; and do not be afraid of hurting the patient, but rather be careful of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And perform in a similar way on the saphenous vein of the other foot.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And the location of the sciatic vein is as we said, it is below the calf, in the lower part of the leg.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting from the patient is for painful hip when it is due to congested blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The method of bloodletting from the patient is that they enter a bath, and quickly and strongly tie the thigh of the affected side with a long thin band above the calf, so that it is not visible except for the purpose of bloodletting.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	Therefore, when the vein appears, then perform bloodletting according to your skill and as perpendicularly as possible, as it is better; or incise it with an incision or cut it with a dry lancet, as the area is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And in most men, it is quite narrow; and if you find it difficult to locate the vein by touch alone, then perform bloodletting on a branch of it that appears on the back of the foot near the base of the fourth and fifth toes.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and allow the blood to flow in the quantity that you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then release the tight binding and place a bandage over the site of bloodletting, pressing firmly to stop the bleeding, as it heals quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Now let's discuss cupping therapy and its methods. [Here is a translation of the whole text:
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping glasses are made from materials such as horn, glass, or bone.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Cupping therapy is performed in two ways: one with scarification and bloodletting, and the other without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And the cupping therapy that is performed without scarification is also done in two ways: with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the cupping glasses that are administered with scarification and bloodletting are placed on fourteen locations of the body, one of which is the nape of the neck, at the back of the head; another is in the middle of the neck, between two parts of the collarbone; a third is under the chin, below the jaw, and below the mouth; a fourth is on the sides of the ribcage, just below the armpits; a fifth is on the liver, near the right hip bone; a sixth is on the two floating ribs, on each side of the body; a seventh is on the two ankles, one on each leg; and an eighth is on the two thighs, one on each leg.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping therapy without bloodletting only draws blood from the small scattered veins in the flesh, and therefore does not have the same effect as bloodletting; moreover, it is not necessary to perform cupping therapy with or without fire in any disease caused by repletion until the body has been completely evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.
