La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in some people, blood is multiplied to the point where it requires extraction through cupping therapy, which can relieve congestion and swelling in the head; in others, there is repletion and redness in the face, neck, and shoulders; in some, there are pimples on the face, forehead, dark circles under the eyes, and sluggishness in the limbs; in still others, cupping therapy can cause bleeding; in yet others, laughter is excessive; in some people, there is a taste of blood in the mouth or the tongue is inflamed and spits out blood; in some, sleep is excessive; and in still others, nosebleeds occur during sleep or for other reasons similar to these.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, when any of these causes are observed, particularly in the third or middle of the month, cupping therapy is recommended to be performed two or three hours after sunrise.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The benefit of cupping therapy on the nape is that it relieves heaviness in the head and congestion in the legs, but it is necessary to ensure complete evacuation of the body through other means as well.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping glass should be placed on the site of bloodletting from the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not permitted to use cupping therapy on those who have a complexion that cannot bear it or those who have a cold, as it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, cupping therapy should not be used on the elderly or those with fragile health conditions.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	However, for those who experience numbness in the area where cupping therapy is applied, it is necessary to instruct the practitioner to gently lift the cup after a short period of time to prevent the development of oblivion (insensitivity).
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Cupping therapy on the back can be performed on the site of bloodletting from the fusca or basilic vein and can alleviate symptoms such as asthma, constriction of the airways, difficulty swallowing, coughing, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	It is necessary to slightly press the cupping glass on the back, as placing it too low can cause weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	Cupping therapy on the temples can alleviate symptoms such as headaches, eye pain, migraines, dizziness, and toothache, and should be performed at the site of bloodletting from the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	It is necessary to instruct the cupping practitioner not to press too hard with their hand during scarification to avoid cutting into an artery and causing excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	Cupping therapy below the chin can alleviate symptoms such as bad breath in the mouth, gum decay, and other oral health issues, and should be performed at the site of bloodletting from the aliheric vein on the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Cupping therapy on the sides of the ribcage can alleviate symptoms such as chest pain caused by congestion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	Cupping therapy on the sides of the ribcage can also benefit from bloodletting from the basilic, fusca, and cephalic veins, as it draws blood from smaller veins in the flesh that connect to these larger veins, thus enhancing the therapeutic effect.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Instruct the cupping practitioner not to cut too deeply during scarification as it can reach the nerves and arteries that lie beneath the skin.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And there is a type of cupping therapy that involves applying it to the hips and can help with hemorrhoids and sores in the area below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	It is necessary to instruct the cupping practitioner to use a large glass made of horn and that it should be used with strong suction, as the area requires deep penetration. Fine, small, and delicate cups should only be used with light suction and accompanied by superficial scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	However, small cups are used for precise targeting and can help draw blood from all over the body, which can be beneficial for chronic pain in the hips and lower back, kidney stones, menstrual cramps, and joint pain, and should be applied to the site of bloodletting from the saphenous veins on both legs.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, their use can weaken the whole body and cause fainting in some individuals. Therefore, they should be used with caution and under the guidance of a trained practitioner.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	The benefit of cupping glasses placed on the shoulders is similar to that of those placed on the hips.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The method of applying cupping therapy involves placing the cups upside down at first and then gradually increasing suction over time. It is important to not keep the cups in one place for too long, but rather to move them gently while allowing the body's natural healing process to take effect.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this process until you see the area become red and swollen, indicating that blood flow has increased to the affected area.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then make small incisions with a lancet and gradually increase suction in the cups, while considering the individual's condition and response to treatment.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For those with delicate skin who are prone to bruising, it is important to make only one incision and not repeat the process, as this can cause ulcers in the skin.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	Instruct the cupping practitioner to make deep incisions and apply suction gently and gradually, to avoid causing excessive pain or discomfort.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if there is an abundance of blood, it is necessary to make two incisions, as the first one will open the pathway for the extraction of blood and water.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	And in the second incision, strive to extract the thicker part of the blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	If the blood is very thick and coagulated, make a third incision to ensure complete extraction.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when you want to extract blood slowly or slightly, one incision is enough for this purpose.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	If you want to extract a large amount of blood, make many incisions, and if you notice that the blood is thick, then make deeper cuts for extraction.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the depth of the scarification incision should be only up to the length of the laden arrow.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person has a thick, hard, dark, and tight-pored skin, it is necessary that the cups' edges be coated with soothing, widening, and loosening substances; if it is in summertime, use aloe oil or violet oil, or oils from crushed donkey's teeth, or cumin seeds; and if it is winter, then use narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity (inflammation) is large and hard, then use bitter oils like wormwood oil, costmary oil, aloe oil, or dill oil, and similar ones.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping practitioner has wide pores and tender flesh, they must avoid using oil; instead, when applying cups to them, wet the edges of the cups with warm water or water infused with herbs like cumin seeds, chicory, or elderflowers, and similar ones.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for those with blood of great moisture, rinse the cups with sour wine or water infused with myrtle and sumac, and similar ones.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for those with large inflammations, rinse the cups with aged wine or water infused with savory (sansuc), which is marjoram, or a decoction of dill, chamomile, and similar ones.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And cupping should be avoided before bathing; it should be administered immediately after bathing for an hour or two, and the person should sleep during that time with the cups still on.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	This sentence is in Medieval Latin:
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is important to consider at the beginning: if the cupping practitioner or the one who is to be bled has a choleric temperament and is prone to sharp, inflammatory blood, they must take cooling remedies, such as vinegar-soaked millet, endive in sour wine and lettuce, scabious, and julep, and similar ones.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And they should eat foods such as poultry and game birds, seasoned dishes with acidic ingredients, and similar ones.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for those with a cold temperament, it is necessary that they drink barley water or barley water infused with scabious seeds, sumac, and fragrant wine mixed half-and-half with vinegar; and they should be advised to eat and drink sparingly, avoiding foods like chicken, rabbit, pigeon, and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And on the day of cupping or bloodletting, it is necessary that their drinks should be greater in quantity than their food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	It is necessary to give some people theriac or medicines containing musk (musk resin), such as nutmeg, before cupping or bloodletting, so that the major limbs are strengthened and the blood becomes thinner; and they should not take any warming substances.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	However, cups used for scarification should be placed on the liver, above the spleen and gout, over the navel, at the joints' locations, and on the large pudendal muscle; these areas cannot tolerate direct scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And this is not desired in those cases but rather the drawing of blood from a part of the body, such as placing a cup on the breast in a case of bloody nasal discharge; and they use that method to dissolve cold phlegmatic windiness in a member, such as placing it on the abdomen and navel. This is because cupping dilates the area, warms it up, and eliminates pain, thus resolving the windiness.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And a cup is also placed on boils when they occur on the eyelids or eyebrow, because through its strong attractive virtue it easily draws out the pus and eradicates the pustule from its location.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, when a cup is placed on the liver or spleen to treat windiness trapped in those organs.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These cups are administered either with suction only, or sometimes with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes cups are administered filled with boiling water in cases of spleen disease.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is to ensure the cup fills up and becomes larger with greater suction, by using only hot water or hot water infused with appropriate herbs.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Here is the description of a cup applied with fire: its orifice should be two fingers wide, as we have shaped it; and the quantity of air inside should be that of a palm's width; and in the base of the cup, at the location within the circumference, place a small hole equal to the size where a needle could enter.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of horn or citron wood, with broad rims, sturdy and smooth, so that it does not damage the skin when placed on the body part.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in its middle there should be a transverse handle made of horn or iron, where a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cup should be larger than the one we previously recommended, and smaller depending on the illness and the condition of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups for infants and weak individuals are different than those used for young and robust adults.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The method for applying this cup with fire to the body is as follows: extend a piece of cloth soaked in decent wood fire in front of a small candle made of wax, and place the cup on top of the transverse handle in its middle location, ensuring that the fire remains near the edge, so as not to burn the patient's skin.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Then the cup should be placed on the patient's body, and the finger should be placed over the small hole we mentioned earlier; until when holding the cups, we do not need to press our fingers and instead allow steam to escape through that opening. When this happens, the cup will quickly lose its suction.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And similarly, with fire, move the cloth as needed and repeat this process if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	However, in the case of a cup used for plague treatment with water, without a transverse handle or hole, it is not administered by suction but rather filled with water and placed on the body part.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the method for using it: This cup, when larger, is better because it can hold more water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Capital LXXXVII
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to large members but rather to those where the positioning of cups is impossible due to their small size, such as the mouth and gums and similar areas; or on exposed flesh, such as the tongue and nose and similar parts.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the method of using leeches that are found in clean, muddy waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Then they should be left in clean water for both day and night until they are hungry, ensuring that no food remains in their stomachs. In the beginning of treatment, bloodletting and cupping should be used to evacuate the patient's body. The affected area should also be rubbed with a cloth until it turns red; then, leeches can be applied to that location.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they become full and fall off.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if suction can be applied to the area with a cup after removing the leeches, it is more beneficial for healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	If not, then wash the area with sour wine and plenty of water; and rub and press it gently.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	If the bleeding from the leech application persists for a long time and forms a residue, then take a piece of cloth and soak it in cold water, place it on top to stop the residual bleeding.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	If the bleeding is excessive, then sprinkle vitriol trisulphate or other styptic powders, like gall nuts, on the wound to stop the bleeding; or place roasted bean halves over the area, allowing them to adhere to the skin until the bleeding stops.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, leeches should be reapplied when it is safe to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	If the use of leeches is not feasible for suction, then rub the area with fresh blood or insert a needle at the location until bleeding starts; and then apply the leeches, as they will quickly detach once they sense blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle a little bit of trisulphate of aloe or salt or ashes on them, and they will quickly fall off.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third section of this text: Restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very important in the medical field and deals with the restoration of bone fractures and dislocations caused by accidents.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, my son, know that this chapter is often boasted about by foolish doctors and the uneducated masses who have never studied ancient texts or read a single letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	Therefore, this method of practicing medicine has become rare among scholars in our land; and I have not forgotten to include it, as it is essential; nor have I relied on recent works alone, but through extensive reading of the ancient texts and dedicated study of their teachings, I have extracted the knowledge contained within them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have also directed myself to experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have described in this chapter all that my knowledge entails and on which I have conducted experiments; as I have summarized it for you and released myself from the burden of lengthy elaboration, I will keep it brief and present a summary of various tools used in this method, as I have done in two previous chapters through added clarification.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	"Summary and collections of what is needed before we begin the recollection of fractured bones and various things to know about each one."
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	"Therefore, we must first speak in this chapter's introduction the summaries of the discourse; and the chapters for which understanding is necessary at the beginning for those who practice this craft and are focused on the truth of them; that is you and those who are eager to learn or master this noble art from you."
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	"And so I say that when a fracture or dislocation or sprain or injury occurs, it is necessary at the beginning to use bloodletting or leeching on the affected area, or any combination of them, if no cause prohibits it, such as weakness of virtue, or if it happened to an infant, or an old person in decrepitude, or if it is a time of intense heat, or cold."
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	"Then let him be content with food that is light, made of fresh herbs and the meat of birds and crustaceans; and prohibit heavy meats and filling up on foods and all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are certain there is no danger of abscess, and if there is no fear of effusion of matter to the limb."
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	"And then return the patient to their original diet, which is customary for them."
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	"And when the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary for the patient to eat nutritious foods that are thick and heavy, in which there is stickiness, such as food made from wheat baked with water, rice, peas, beef, poultry, fresh fish, coarse wine and similar to these, and with this diet, the consolidation of the fracture occurs more easily."
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	"And know that fractured bones in men who are either very young or old and decrepit, cannot be continuously healed and consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of their members."
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	"And they are healed and consolidated according to their nature at all times due to the dryness of their members, and they are healed and consolidated when they are in good condition, and this is true for the bones of young children."
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	"But nature adjusts and provides for the fractured bone by any means necessary, such as thickening that adheres to it and strengthens it until they are consolidated and united together, until they reach the point of strength and firmness, just like fire at the beginning, before any cause prevents it from performing its function."
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And for this reason, it is necessary to stop the patient from eating heavy and sticky foods, as we have mentioned."
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	"There are various types of fractures according to the different parts of the body."
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	"And know that the types of fractures are different according to the diversity of body parts, for a fracture in the bone of the leg is different from a fracture in the skull, and a fracture in the bone of the chest is different from a fracture in the bone of the back, and similarly all other members are different from each other."
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	"And I will defeat forgetfulness with a recollection of every type of fracture, explained in its own distinct chapter."
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	"There are various types of fractures within themselves."
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	"And the types of fractures in bones are differentiated within themselves; for there is arch-shaped fracture, others that occur crosswise, and some are fractured according to the length of the bone. And there are star-shaped fractures, splintered fractures, and those with or without additional pieces, just like a pen when it is prepared to write, and there is a fracture with wound and disruption in the skull, and there is a small fissure fracture."
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	"And for every type of fracture, there is a specific remedy and pain in healing it, as will be explained in its own place."
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	"Signs of bone fracture."
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	"And by these signs a bone fracture is recognized: crookedness of the limb, swelling and appearance to touch, and when compressing it with your hand."
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	"And therefore, when there is no crookedness or swelling visible and the patient does not feel pain when you touch the bone with movement, then it is not a fracture."
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	"However, it is possible that there may be crookedness or a small fissure, therefore you should not touch or compress the limb with force, but instead pause and apply medicine that is appropriate for the location, as will be remembered at that moment. And let it be tight with subtle compression."
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	"And know that when the limb is crooked but not split in two or any other thing that does not happen to it atrophy, such as swelling of all parts of its comparison, then you should begin immediately the process of straightening it, provided that there is no danger of abscess."
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	"And if there is an abscess, then you should leave it alone for several days until the abscess ceases, and then treat it in any way possible with lightness and skill."
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	"And know that the healing of a dislocation is easier and quicker than a fracture in which atrophy occurs."
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	"And strengthen it as will be remembered later."
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	"But if there is atrophy in the bone, then it is necessary to extend the broken member separated into two parts, whether it is an arm or a leg, using your hand if the limb is small, or with two ropes or one rope and your hand."
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	"And your position should be such that you hold the limb in its natural shape while the parts of the broken member are extended, then make sure to perform it carefully and skillfully return those additional pieces to their places."
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	"And be careful with your strength so as not to cause pain or injury to the patient during your operation, and make sure that you align one bone to its companion in the best possible way according to your ability."
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	"And it is necessary that at that time you skillfully touch the limb with your hand, and if you see any other cause, correct it and treat it according to your ability."
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	"And avoid violent extension and compression, just as foolish doctors often cause abscesses by their operation or cause contractions in the limb, as we have seen with the operations of many of them."
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	"And provide attachment, alignment, proper and careful operation, and pressure on the limb, as well as rest and tranquility; advise the patient to avoid injuring it during their waking hours and while sleeping, observe its movement and agitation, pay attention to its excretion, and pay attention to all its movements with all its strength. And wait until the position of the limb is in a position where pain is avoided, this is because when there is pain or injury in the position of the limb, it is necessary to change to another position where there is no pain. And make sure that the position of the limb is straight and aligned so that when it heals, it does not become crooked."
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	"And the quality of the pressure on the limb should be as recommended, for you should know that fractured members are differentiated in their smallness and greatness and in the shape of them."
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	"And for those that are small, such as the arm and finger and thumb and similar to them, it is necessary that the wrapping be of fine fabric."
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	"But for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary that they be wrapped in a hard and firm manner because the firm wrapping connects the large and strong member in every part with pressure, so that no filth enters into it."
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	"And begin, pause appropriately with careful alignment, starting from the location of the fracture with three or four wrappings depending on the limb, and apply a little pressure with your hand on the bandage."
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	"And come towards the upper part of the location of the fracture and apply less pressure than the tightness with which you have strengthened the location of the fracture."
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	"And extend yourself with wrapping of the location of the fracture slightly, and gradually loosen the pressure until you reach a large portion of it."
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	"And take another bandage and wrap it around the other side of the fracture with wrapping, and bring the wrappings to the lower part of the fracture; and your operation should be in the tightness of the wrapping and in loosening that as we have said in the first wrapping above."
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	"And place between the layers of soft wool or fabric that aligns the crookedness of the fracture, if there is any, and if not, do not place anything in it."
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	"And place another bandage, and align the layers of splints properly, but if there is no swelling or abscess in the location, then place it on top of these wrappings. But if there is swelling or abscess in the location, then leave it alone for several days, and then apply the splints."
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	"And let the splints be made of hard cane or carefully crafted wood, or from palm branches, and let the width of each splint be according to this form and shape."
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	"However, it is necessary that the splint placed on the fracture be larger and wider than the other splints by a little, and the length of the splint should be according to the size of the limb. And bind the splints with another bandage according to your first tightness, and tie it above with string properly as we have said about pressure, that is, let your tightness be greater near the fracture and less as you move away from it."
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	"And it is necessary that the strings be medium in thickness and fineness and made of flax; and if the strings are thick, as I have seen with some foolish doctors using cords of twisted flax for their operation, this is a great error because it does not allow for equal tightness."
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	"And thin strings are also not appropriate because you cannot achieve the tightness you want with them, and it is necessary that there be less than a finger’s width between splint and splint."
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	"And if the patient is injured by the ends of the splints at the tightened locations, then place wool or red woollen cloth underneath it so that it does not cause injury."
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	"Sometimes a fracture occurs with a wound and there is disruption in the skull, I will come to remember it in its own chapter according to its uniqueness."
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	"And know that not all broken limbs can be aligned with splints on the first day; this is because for large limbs, it is not necessary to place splints immediately but rather after 5 or 7 days or more, depending on your certainty of the occurrence of abscess."
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	"And this is the method of plasters with which the ancients healed, they were placed on fractures and dislocations and sprains."
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	"Method of a plaster as an ointment for the healing of fractures, suitable for many complexities and especially for women and children because it does not generate heat or cold: take powdered flour, which is the soft inner part of the grain ground by the movement of the mill against the walls of the mill."
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	"And sift that as it is with the white of an egg, and apply the mixture of it in a thick but not thin or fine layer, and use that."
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to make an ointment for the restoration of fractures, dislocations, and twists: take assafoetida, lapis lazuli, acacia, enula campana, migrach (which is wild marjoram), all in quantities of one drachma; myrrh and aloe, each in quantities of five drachmas; oil of aloes in a quantity of twenty drachmas; grind and sift them and mix them with either rose water or egg white if the patient's complexion is scaly; then use this ointment, for it has a good composition and restores broken bones easily, and benefits many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way to make an ointment that benefits fractures and sprains: take wild marjoram, meadow sweet in a quantity of one drachma; myrrh and aloe each in quantities of five drachmas; acacia in a quantity of six drachmas; and Armenian bole in a quantity of twenty drachmas.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:

Here's my translation of the final sentence: Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:

Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:

Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	Here's my translation of the final sentence:
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if a violent pain, pressure, or swelling occurs at the site, then you should loosen or unbind it at that time and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a piece of linen and a wet sea sponge, and submerge them in warm water, then use those to gently wash the area until the swelling subsides and the pain is alleviated; then let the limb rest for an hour; and place over it a cloth steeped in vinegar and rose oil, and leave it on for one night so that you can be sure there is no danger of infection, and that the inflammation of the limb is reduced, and the pain has subsided.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then gradually tighten the bandage and use a small amount of plaster without pulling too hard due to initial constriction, and gradually loosen it as the area heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess, fever, pain, inflammation and all symptoms have completely subsided, and you no longer need a plaster or bandage, then gradually loosen it as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause arises with regard to the limb that I have mentioned, then do not loosen it for three or four or five or seven days. And sometimes all of this is left for twenty days, as you see fit by the loosening of the limb, as I have said, until the fracture heals and approaches the coagulation of the flesh around it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the bandage more than your initial constriction, and adjust it according to the patient's food intake, as their recovery allows.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the area of the fracture is drying out and becoming more withered than it should, then you should know that nutrition is not reaching it; and therefore immerse it in warm water every time you change the bandage; and do this for three days; and slightly loosen the bandage, so that nourishment can reach the limb and heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what foolish healers of fractures often do when the treatment is not successful at the beginning, and the bone heals in a crooked manner, is an error according to their method, and it brings great danger; if they were skilled, they would have enlarged the ancient methods, and with that they could have achieved better results.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do this, which is why it is more reasonable to not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On Fracture When It Occurs in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	Chapter Two: On Fracture When It Occurs in the Head.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the severity of these two types of fractures can be great or small, and there is also another type called "compression" or "grinding"; this occurs as a result of blunt force trauma or striking against a hard surface, among other similar causes.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this type of fracture is "penetrating", meaning that it approaches the membrane beneath the bone on the outside; or it occurs on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two types can be great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is another type of fracture that occurs along the subtlety of the bone in a thin line, and for this reason it is called "capillary fracture".
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is also a type of fracture that occurs as a result of impact or blunt force trauma, causing a piece of bone to penetrate into the layers inside; this happens in concave areas, similar to how it occurs with earthenware pots when they are struck and shatter, with pieces breaking off and entering the interior.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this type of fracture is most often found in the bones of infants or young children, whose skulls are still soft and flexible.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures can be classified as "separated shards", like scattered stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	I will return to the explanation of all of this in its proper place. [https://www.facebook.com/groups/1258690374419657/permalink/1321059746942838/](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1258690374419657/permalink/1321059746942838/)
