Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The kneecap (denolh) can be dislocated in three ways: either to the outer parts, to the inner parts, or downwards towards the back; it is not dislocated towards the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of a dislocated kneecap (denolh) is that you command the patient to bend their leg and bring it towards their thigh, and if they are unable to do so, then you know that the kneecap is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all types of dislocation of the kneecap (denolh) is as follows: have the patient lie down straight, and if they are able to, extend their leg; place your two hands on it, and place the patient's foot between your legs; then press the kneecap with your palms, holding it firmly between your fingers, while another minister extends the patient's leg until the kneecap returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of the dislocated kneecap (denolh) is that the thigh adheres to the hip without effort or difficulty.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply a paste on the kneecap (denolh) and bind it to the thigh with bandages for three or four days, then undo the bandages.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And the patient should not walk for several days, until they have healed and regained strength.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of the kneecap (denolh) is difficult for you, then apply strong extension with ligaments, as was described in the treatment of a hip dislocation earlier.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Chapter 33: Treatment for Dislocation of the Ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Some times the ankle is swollen due to minor injury, and sometimes it is dislocated based on its position, and the dislocation can occur in the inner or outer parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the ankle dislocation is that you can see the ankle swollen, pointing towards the direction where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment for the swelling of the ankle is simple and it consists of stretching it gently with hands and bandaging it so that it returns to its normal state.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But when treating a dislocation based on its position, it is necessary to lay the patient down straight, and have a strong and capable assistant stand behind their affected side in the middle of their back.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you should place your right hand on the higher part of the foot and your left hand on the lower part of the foot at the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot towards your right hand and hold it with your left hand twice, extending it, and then push the heel of the foot with your right hand towards the thigh without any effort.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that twice, as we have mentioned.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then push the heel of the foot against the thigh for the third time and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two tries following this method and you see the foot bandaged, then it is good. But if not, then you should repeat the operation because it will return (to its normal state).
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from treating it as we have recommended, then make the patient lie down on their back on the ground, place a solid piece of wood or something similar under them, which fits between their thighs, and wrap a cloth around them so that they do not get hurt.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And have the assistant of the patient hold their thighs and have another assistant stretch the foot with their hands or use a device that goes around the leg of the foot, and let each assistant pull on either side against each other's force, and make sure that the wooden piece is placed between the patient's thighs holding it in place so that the body of the patient does not move towards the lower parts because of the extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And let the doctor bandage the dislocation with their hands and another assistant hold the healthy thigh downwards because the dislocation will return easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you are assured of the success of the treatment, then apply a plaster and use bandages strongly to wrap around the foot and leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And it is necessary to be careful or avoid the nerves which are behind the ankle, because applying strong bandages over them can harm and hurt them significantly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And let it remain for two or three days, and if the bandage becomes softer, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And unwrap it on the third or fourth day and forbid the patient from walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to walk before that time frame, then there is no guarantee that the dislocation will not be re-injured and become corrupt, which may prevent healing from taking place.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an abscess forms, then it is necessary to administer in the treatment of that abscess what we have previously mentioned in our narrative, in a place for healing and incision until it is swollen (reduced).
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Capital Chapter 34. (This indicates the end of one chapter and the beginning of another.)
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Chapter 34: Treatment for Dislocation of Toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that the dislocated toe be bandaged with a little extension without much effort, and this is not difficult, it is light (to do).
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the joints of the toe, then it is necessary to make the patient lie down with their foot on a flat surface or table and keep their body still as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And you should stand with your weight on one foot and place the patient's foot on top of yours, right at the joints, and then press it down with your foot using force until it returns (to its normal state), making sure that the area is bandaged and there is no swelling.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then place a board under the patient's foot that supports the whole foot, with two ends, and hold it firmly with tension for three days; then unwrap it and let the patient rest from walking for many days, until they are healed and recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Capital Chapter 35. (This indicates the end of one chapter and the beginning of another.)
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Chapter 35: Types of Dislocation Made by Plague, Fracture or Any Combination.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occur and you attempt to treat them and restore the affected area, many times it results in death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And so it is not advisable to be presumptuous in treating such cases, but only those who are skilled in the art, with long experience, merciful and compassionate, slow, not rash or overconfident; and who in the beginning use medicines that only reduce abscesses, leaving the patient to divine judgement, unless there is hope for salvation from danger, relief of suffering, and some sign of improvement.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so you must try to make the reduction as soon as possible in the early stages of the cause, before abscesses form.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the member returns as we desire, then administer a regimen that reduces abscesses and treat the plague with drying agents appropriate for the wounds.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is accompanied by a fracture and separate fragments are formed in the bone, then you must perform their stabilization and do what we have said in the treatment of simple injuries as described earlier in those sections.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And be careful and avoid any harm within your power according to the teachings that I have previously given you; for this is better for you in front of your Creator, and more lasting for your glory, and truly beneficial to your body at the right time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the perfect words of Albucasis, may God bless him. (This is a closing sentence often used in medieval texts to indicate the end of a work.)
Amen.	Indeed, amen. (This is a response often used in religious contexts to express agreement or confirmation of a prayer or blessing.)
